programme.title: 2021: War of the Worlds (2021)
programme.desc: Sibling astronomers discover Martians are threatening to invade Earth, but no one believes them until the aliens attack New York. As the siblings try to make it out of the city with their families, they discover the Martians have no immunity against the diseases of Earth, and realise they must work this fact to their advantage. Sci-fi thriller, starring Tom Sizemore, Anthony Jensen and Emily Killian

programme.title: Becky (2020)
programme.desc: Rebellious 13-year-old Becky and her father head for a weekend getaway at a lake house in an effort to reconnect. For Becky, the trip takes a turn for the worse when her father's new girlfriend and her son show up as well. Before long, a group of escaped convicts, led by the murderous Dominick, take the family hostage. However, they haven't reckoned on the rage and resourcefulness of Becky as they seek a precious item. Thriller, starring Lulu Wilson, Kevin James and Joel McHale

programme.title: Father Brown

The next day his body is found in a locked room and Father Brown suspects he has been poisoned. Such events prompt local speculation to mount that Kembleford is under threat of an alien invasion. Mark Williams stars

programme.title: Annika
programme.desc: The team are called in when writer Cara Gibson is found dead under a bridge. Her books ruined careers and left a lot of lives in tatters, but which of these people would be driven to murder?

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: A recent rape is linked to two similar attacks at a chocolate factory 10 years previously, leaving the team with no choice but to reopen all three cases. The detectives uncover news not only of an unhappy workforce, but also of an alleged suicide, and their investigation becomes even more complicated when they discover a severed finger was found in one of the company's snacks. After a visit to the doctor, Gerry decides to quit smoking, and instead of resorting to nicotine patches or gum, he enlists Sandra to help him quit

programme.title: Cutting It
programme.desc: Allie opens her own hairdressing academy, and acquires the financial support of a former boy band member looking to escape his old showbiz life. Elsewhere, a new arrival wheedles her way into a position of authority in the business

programme.title: Bad Girls
programme.desc: Joy is so depressed about her daughter's arrival in the prison she hits the bottle hard and doesn't even notice that the Costa Cons' delivery of healthy fruit is laced with alcohol. programme.title: Lovejoy

programme.desc: Chloe is interviewed over her assault, while Ange battles to keep Evan alive, but with so many conflicting versions of events, it remains uncertain if the truth will out. Ric tries to support his granddaughter while secretly arranging an MRI scan to uncover the cause of his declining cognitive abilities

Whilst in one of the country's largest agricultural counties, Jonnie also pays a visit to a land-based college to find out about the changing face of farming practices with the next generation of farmers

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: Nigel Havers hosts at five sets of sellers bring their precious items to the Bidding Room. The dealers bid for a pair of cherub wall lights, a collection of miniature Ferrari cars, an early 1900's brass microscope, a pair of carved mirrors and a light up grocer's sign

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Kim and Denise try to break up Ravi and Chelsea, but Ravi has other plans. Callum receives an urgent work call that changes things for the people on the square and Freddie confronts his old teacher

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Jay Blades and his team of experts welcome Rokeya and Patricia into the Repair Shop who have brought in a painting that has been in their family since it was commissioned in the early 1950s. Kirsten Ramsay takes on the challenge of repairing a clay keepsake of Emese and Luke's son's footprints. David, who died at just five months old, was diagnosed with a rare heart condition in 2020 and the clay has already started to crack. Nick and Pat from West Yorkshire bring in a thermometer that was used to measure extreme temperatures when they lived in the Arctic. The last visitor of the day is Bekki, who brings the remains of an antique glass and lead terrarium that has been completely destroyed after being couriered from Spain to her home after her grandparents died

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc: The five pairs leave Dawson City and head south to the third checkpoint, 2,700km away in Alberta but the stakes are raised as the team who reach the destination last will be eliminated. Race leaders Trisha and Cathie enjoy a 25-hour lead over their nearest competitors but after hiring a car in the last leg they take a risk on car sharing their way to Alberta. Disaster strikes for Monique who injures herself at the checkpoint causing her and father Ladi a further three-hour delay. Zainib and Mobeen formulate a new strategy and Marc has to face his fears. Forty-five hours behind Trisha and Cathie are Claudia and Kevin, sitting in last place with their no-frills strategy

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Highlights of this evening's Premier League fixtures, featuring Manchester United v Brentford at Old Trafford and West Ham United v Newcastle United at London Stadium. United were looking to avenge a 4-0 defeat at the hands of Brentford in August. West Ham held Newcastle to a draw when the teams met two months ago, but both teams were in need of a win this time around for differing reasons. Plus, action from last night's contests, which were Chelsea v Liverpool, Bournemouth v Brighton & Hove Albion, Leeds United v Nottingham Forest and Leicester City v Aston Villa

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc: Former world champion boxer Anthony Crolla, sport broadcaster Eilidh Barbour, Commonwealth gold medal winning netballer Eboni Usoro-Brown and Scottish rugby star Adam Hastings join team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness on the quiz

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars
programme.desc: The acerbic chef resumes his search for the country's most exciting and innovative new food and drink business, hand-picking 12 of the UK's best up-and-coming food and drink entrepreneurs to compete to earn an investment - 150,000 of his own money. He starts by inviting the contenders to Glenapp Castle, where he tasks them with creating banquets celebrating his birth-place - Scotland. Will they thrive under pressure or crumble as members of the Edinburgh Royal Military Tattoo, no less, sit down to feast?

programme.title: The Moment of Proof
programme.desc: How a USB stick found in the raid of a woman's house led to the downfall of her online drugs empire. Plus, the way in which police targeted the man responsible for converted weapons flooding the UK. Narrated by Chuku Modu

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: The park may finally get its first emu chick, though the keepers beed to persuade the male emu to sit on the eggs. Elsewhere, it's touch-and-go again with the rock hyrax babies, while Kate Humble spots a wild white-tailed sea eagle visiting the park and Jean Johansson helps out with a moth survey

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts and Martel Maxwell check out a house in Maidstone, Kent, a flat in North Shields, Tyneside, and an office with planning permission for a flat above it in Bognor Regis, West Sussex

programme.title: Virtually Home
programme.desc: A retired couple in Uxbridge, west London, call on the help of interior designer Simon Hamilton and the Virtual Reality studio for advice on how to redesign their tired living room. They have very different views when it comes to colour and style, but will immersing them in the space using cutting-edge virtual reality technology mean they can feel comfortable about which way to go?

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman looks for a period property in rural West Sussex suitable for a couple with a toddler. She also tries her hand at the rare art of fore-edge painting

programme.title: Unbeatable

programme.desc: Alex Scott and Gethin Jones host the live magazine show featuring a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Kim and Denise continue to try and break up Chelsea and Ravi regardless of what he says but the pair are thrown off when she supports him over them. Freddie is proud of himself for standing up to Mr Hawthorne

programme.desc: A child-friendly sunscreen applicator and a hard-water shower filter are demonstrated, and a collectable whisky company offers an interesting guarantee to self-made millionaires Peter Jones, Deborah Meaden, Touker Suleyman, Sara Davies and Steven Bartlett. Presented by Evan Davis

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars
programme.desc: Gordon invites his 11 contenders to Anglesey, north Wales, to test their raw skills and pure talent. After an expert masterclass on seaweed, the teams must precisely identify and harvest samples of the sustainable crop. Up against the tides, they need to traverse the rocks, to prove they can follow instructions. Next, Gordon tests the contenders' ability to run a business in Wales' glorious 'Little Italy' by the sea, Portmeirion. He asks the teams to create and sell pizzas to locals and tourists - whichever team takes the most money wins. Finally, it's crunch-time as the contenders come face to face with the acerbic chef

programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.desc: Tattoo artist Alex and social worker Amy live in Sunderland and have five children under the age of five, including identical triplets. They anticipate that their Christian faith, family and community can help them juggle a chaotic home-life now that they're both back to work and the toddlers are getting more and more active

programme.title: A Very British Cult
programme.desc: Catrin Nye and her team expose control, intimidation and fear at a mysterious life coaching company that allegedly takes over people's lives and rips families apart. As the investigation heats up, the group fights back and there's a surreal final showdown

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Comedian and writer Tom Allen, former Blue Peter presenter Sarah Greene, rugby star Ugo Monye and comedian Morgana Robinson join host Rob Brydon and regular captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the offbeat panel show. As usual, the participants set out to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible fibs about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory, through rounds such as Home Truths and Quick-fire Lies

programme.title: Celebrity Mastermind
programme.desc: Journalist John Pienaar, lead singer of Britpop band Shed Seven, Rick Witter, comedian Suzi Ruffell, and actor Dakota Blue Richards are in the famous black chair, answering Clive Myrie's questions on Clement Attlee, the Smiths, the films of Sandra Bullock, and the music of Lana Del Rey

programme.desc: How a fax led police to a shipping container smuggling a significant amount of drugs into the UK. Plus, how a cheque for a mattress linked a killer to a body found at a football stadium. Narrated by Chuku Modu

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: It's the 10th anniversary of the arrival of Anne, one of Europe's oldest elephants who spent most of her life in the circus. Kate and Ben find out the lengths the keepers go to in order to maintain her in the best condition possible. Plus, wildlife photographer Hamza Yassin witnesses some unique tiger behaviour and Jean Johansson lends the keepers a hand feeding the koalas

programme.title: My Life at Easter with Sally Phillips
programme.desc: Part one of two. Sally meets writer and broadcaster Gyles Brandreth to discover how Easter has informed a life filled with love, faith, politics and pantomime. Gyles's story takes him from family Easter egg hunts and searching for the secrets of happiness through to the paradox of combining a love of frivolity and light entertainment with a political career. For once, Gyles is lost for words as he discusses his blessings on an emotional spring walk with the host

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Danny Sebastian hosts the show from Eccleston, Lancashire, and visits Astley Hall in Chorley to learn about some intriguing furniture. With experts Izzie Balmer and Colin Young

programme.desc: When a car is pulled from Port Devine Harbour, the whole town searches for a missing taxi driver whose daughter claims she was about to start a new life in England. So why would she drive her car into the sea? Meanwhile, Al's efforts to pay off his blackmailer lead him to desperate measures - which results in him kissing someone he shouldn't

programme.title: Virtually Home
programme.desc: A couple in Glasgow who have been living together for just a year, call on the help of interior designer Karen Livingstone Welstead, and the Virtual Reality studio for advice on how to revamp their living room that has a distinctly studenty feel. They have very different views when it comes to style, so hope using cutting-edge virtual reality technology will give them a better idea of what to do

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: A health-conscious couple from London enlist Sonali Shah to help them spend 1.3million on a detached property in Surrey with enough land to create a wellness retreat

programme.desc: Nigel Havers hosts as five dealers battle each other to buy items brought in by the public. programme.desc: Romesh Ranganathan invites John Robins, James Haskell, Bobby Seagull, Amanda Abbington, Sarah Kendall, Des Clarke, Yinka Bokinni and Su Pollard to bank money for chosen charities as they answer questions against the clock, blocking out rivals at the end of each round

programme.title: Beyond Paradise
programme.desc: Reeling from Martha's decision, Humphrey focuses his attentions on an inexplicable crime. A house has been burgled and all forensic evidence points to one suspect only. The only problem is that this suspect was locked up by Kelby in the station's police cell. With the arrival of the suspect's hardnosed lawyer, the team is under pressure to get results but with Humphrey distracted, it falls to Esther to take the lead on this investigation and crack the case. Meanwhile, despite her mother's protestations, Martha remains firm, however painful it might be. Detective drama, starring Kris Marshall and Sally Bretton

Hosted by Rob Brydon, with team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack joined by celebrity guests including Bob Mortimer, Shirley Ballas, Josie Gibson, Chris McCausland, Bez, Motsi Mabuse, Shazia Mirza, Steve Pemberton, Munya Chawawa, Alice Roberts, Snoochie Shy, Chizzy Akudolu, Simon Gregson, Henning Wehn, Jayde Adams, Laurence Llewelyn-Bowen, Ellie Simmonds and Mist

programme.title: The Cleaner
programme.desc: Wicky is called to a shooting in a technology shop, where he finds himself sharing the night shift with a shelf-stacking conspiracy theorist who is preparing for the end of the world - which he insists is just around the corner. Wicky isn't sure whether the man is paranoid or just being sensible, but either way he has to decide where his own priorities lie. Dark comedy, starring Greg Davies, with Asim Chaudhry

programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Avengers: Age of Ultron (2015)
programme.desc: The superhero team faces a threat from within when Iron Man creates an artificial intelligence to take their place protecting the world. The android grows resentful of his creators, and decides his mission is best accomplished by wiping out the human race. Meanwhile, two vengeful superpowered twins seek to turn the Avengers against each other. Sci-fi adventure sequel, starring Robert Downey Jr, Chris Hemsworth, Chris Evans and Scarlett Johansson

programme.desc: Nigel Havers presents as five sets of sellers bring their items to the Bidding Room. programme.title: See Hear
programme.desc: Weekly magazine for the deaf and hard of hearing. With voiceover

programme.title: 24/7 Pet Hospital
programme.desc: Cameras follow daily events at a Co Durham pet hospital, as its specialist vets and staff attend the needs of animals 24 hours each day. A rescue kitten is having trouble walking, so the team investigates why. A French Bulldog is in labour, while a Labrador puppy finds out whether his operation has been a success. Narrated by Kieran Bew

programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the quiz in which contestants compete for the chance to win 10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers' Pubs That Built Britain
programme.desc: Dave heads to the valleys of south Wales, where he uncovers the history of various establishments and unearths pubs that were at the heart of the area's coal mining communities. Along the way, he journeys underground to the coal face to find out what life was like, meets an award-winning choir, and drives a steam train with a pub at the end of its line

programme.title: The Big Painting Challenge
programme.desc: The seven remaining artists are challenged to show off their waterscape painting skills during a visit to Loch Lomond. Firstly, they must paint a boat on the water during a particularly windy day, before creating a panoramic view of the entire lake. They also receive a masterclass on mixing colours before local members of the public choose a favourite to go through to the semi-final

programme.title: My Unique B&B
programme.desc: Master craftsman Simon Parfett and his team travel to Somerset where owners Sue, David and Katie have asked for help to create a fairytale treehouse

programme.title: Your Home Made Perfect
programme.desc: Architects Laura Jane Clark and Robert Jamison come up with virtual reality designs to transform a Halifax couple's 19th-century home. When owner Paula developed MS, it became vital to make the house more wheelchair accessible - but her partner Jeremy also sees an opportunity to give it a stylish new look. Laura's concept makes the most of the views of the garden and uses clever recycling tricks to stretch the budget, while Robert deploys off-the-shelf materials to making the place more accessible

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Paul Martin revisits some of the historic venues from the series' history. He also finds out about the scandalous Georgians of Lydiard Park

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Kemah Bob, JJ Chalmers, Kevin Clifton and Victoria Derbyshire test their general knowledge skills in the hope of winning a prize

programme.title: Coast to Coast Food Festival
programme.desc: Colin Murray and Edith Bowman discover tips and treats at the food and music festival in Newcastle. They find out how to create award-winning burgers and reveal the secrets of chips, French-Canadian style. Briony-May Williams goes on the trail of the nation's favourite herb and chef Julie Lin sets sail to find Scotland's most valuable fish. Farmer Meinir Howells investigates the growing popularity of keeping chickens

programme.title: Jay's Yorkshire Workshop
programme.desc: Angie, a matron at Airedale General Hospital in West Yorkshire, nominates primary school St Anne's in Keighley. During lockdown, children from the school fundraised for the hospital, raising more than 10 times their initial 200 target by taking part in sponsored exercise. Jay Blades then travels to Hebden Bridge in the Calder Valley - an area that has suffered from heavy flooding and damage in the past few years. Here, he meets local resident Karen, who wants to nominate Trevor, a volunteer flood warden who has helped Karen and other local residents when their homes have been devastated

programme.title: Rebuilding Notre-Dame
programme.desc: In a programme first shown 12 months ago, Lucy Worsley is given access to the cathedral in Paris at a critical point in the restoration, as building work is being ramped up in a bid to meet the ambitious deadline to reopen it to the public in 2024. Lucy meets scientists, historians and craftspeople working to return the 850-year-old Gothic masterpiece to its former glory. The fire coated Notre-Dame with tons of toxic lead dust, so specialists are now decontaminating the site

programme.title: Saving Lives in Leeds
programme.desc: Kostas Papagiannopoulos's surgical list includes 79-year-old Barry, who has a suspicious growth on his lung. Previous attempts to diagnose it have failed, so Kostas uses keyhole surgery to remove a section of lung before sending it off for immediate analysis, waiting in theatre in case he has to proceed further. Meanwhile, Andrew Hogarth treats 52-year-old Roger, who has been on the cardiac ward for a week with a life-threatening infection

programme.title: The Cockfields
programme.desc: Sunday finds preparations for Simon's 40th birthday in full swing - amid much stress levels. Larry arrives with a very hungover Melissa, who immediately disrupts proceedings. After an awkward lunch it's present time and Larry gives Simon a red leather jacket which, to Ray's delight, looks ridiculous on him. Eventually Melissa joins the party, but rejects Sue's food. Simon tries to defend his father's behaviour to Ray and an argument ensues until David drops a bombshell that makes Simon's birthday one he'll never forget. Comedy, starring Joe Wilkinson, Diane Morgan, Sue Johnston and Bobby Ball

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Victoria Derbyshire

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Secrets of the Chippendales Murders
programme.desc: How the rise of the dance troupe brought a growing mountain of problems, including the attention of mobsters, disgruntled dancers and churchgoers. Nick De Noia and Steve Banerjee, the two masterminds behind the show, quickly grew obsessed with their fortunes - until a shocking murder which left NYPD detectives at a loss

programme.title: See Hear
programme.desc: Weekly magazine for the deaf and hard of hearing. With voiceover

programme.title: Amanda & Alan's Italian Job
programme.desc: Amanda Holden aims to bring a slice of Hollywood to Sicily with a banana leaf-patterned boudoir as she takes the reins designing the master bedroom. Alan Carr is concerned her camp theme is on the wrong side of tacky, so she takes him to visit one of Palermo's most prestigious hotels to show how exuberant dcor has enticed high-profile guests including famous composer Richard Wagner. To bring her vision to life, Amanda ropes in her DIY-loving father to help build a bespoke four-poster bed. Alan, meanwhile, learns to kick back like the Italians do, with a lesson in the art of doing nothing

programme.title: Saving Lives in Leeds
programme.desc: Documentary following doctors and surgeons working for Leeds Hospitals Trust as they decide who to treat next on their ever-increasing waiting lists. At Leeds General Infirmary, Professor Simon Kay stands ready to perform a rare double hand transplant, while in neurosurgery Kenan Deniz has two patients needing urgent brain operations

programme.title: Becoming Frida Kahlo
programme.desc: Documentary charting the life and career of the Mexican artist, beginning with her early years when a young Frida grew up in a time of revolution. The programme looks at her rebellious schooldays and a fateful encounter with Diego Rivera, then one of the world's most famous artists and the man who would change her life

programme.title: Paul Whitehouse: Our Troubled Rivers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Paul visits the River Wye and discovers how an explosion of algae caused by fertiliser run-off from farming is part of a cocktail overwhelming the habitats along the waterway. He travels to Hampshire where he hears about the damage being caused to rare and precious chalk streams, before discovering how regular sewage discharges on the coast are causing problems for Whitstable's famous oyster industry. Ending his journey in London, Paul finds a beacon of hope in the form of the 4.4billion Thames Tideway super sewer

For the first challenge, they must depict an endurance runner and a cyclist, while the final test involves gymnast's floor and beam routines

programme.title: My Unique B&B
programme.desc: Simon Parfett and his team help create a unique agricultural-themed B&B for Will and his family, who have been farming their land in Lincolnshire for generations

programme.title: Your Home Made Perfect
programme.desc: Laura Jane Clark and Robert Jamison create virtual reality redesigns for a spacious Wiltshire home that used to be a hair salon - so is poorly designed for actually living in, with a ground floor that feels like two separate properties, each with its own front door. Laura gives the building a welcoming entrance while making the interior family-friendly and functional, while Robert comes up with an innovative approach that cuts down on the amount of floor space but which could radically alter the way the owners live

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Jonathan Pratt and Michael Baggott assess items at Barrow Hill Roundhouse in Derbyshire and Paul Martin visits the village of Hathersage, which provided inspiration for Jane Eyre

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Kemah Bob, JJ Chalmers, Kevin Clifton and Victoria Derbyshire test their general knowledge skills in the hope of winning a prize

programme.title: Coast to Coast Food Festival
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher and Edith Bowman explore the Manchester Food and Drink Festival, meeting passionate producers of chilli sauce, Eritrean curries and Italian biscuits among the stalls. Onkar Singh Purewal discovers how it is possible to grow tea in the Vale of Glamorgan, while farmer Jim Smith gets stuck into some sticky sweets

programme.title: Cornwall with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: The explorer goes back to the county as the energy and cost-of-living crisis began to take its toll to find out what life is like for the locals after the summer crowds have gone. Simon examines why Cornwall is one of the most desirable parts of the country and a favourite holiday destination while also being one of the most deprived counties in England

programme.title: Reunion Hotel
programme.desc: Alex Jones gives people a chance to be reunited with someone pivotal from their past, beginning with 21-year-old Tegan, whose life was saved by a stranger after she fell onto a Tube track. Cameras also follow Lee, who hopes to meet his brother for the first time, and Pippa, a youngster who wants to thank volunteers for a life-changing home improvement which helped ease her rare skin condition

programme.title: Get on Up: The Triumph of Black America
programme.desc: David Harewood takes viewers from the birth of hip-hop in the early 1980s to the present day. He explores how a new generation of producers and performers increasingly began to own their 'creative capital', and became billionaires with lifestyles to match. David also examines the influence of hip-hop on 90s film with director Allen Hughes, and meets Black Panther star Florence Kasumba

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Dara O Briain and Hugh Dennis look back at some of the news from the week with guests Angela Barnes, Alasdair Beckett-King, Rhys James, Ria Lina and Josh Pugh

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events with Victoria Derbyshire

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Saving Lives in Leeds
programme.desc: Kostas Papagiannopoulos's surgical list includes 79-year-old Barry, who has a suspicious growth on his lung. Previous attempts to diagnose it have failed to Kostas uses keyhole surgery to remove a section of lung before sending it off for immediate analysis, waiting in theatre in case he has to proceed further. Meanwhile, Andrew Hogarth treats 52-year-old Roger, who has been on the cardiac ward for a week with a life-threatening infection

programme.title: The Railway Man (2013)
programme.desc: A traumatised former prisoner of war gets married, but continues to suffer nightmares about his experiences. He is unable to talk to his wife about his time in captivity, so she tracks down a fellow hostage to learn the truth - and discovers the cruel Japanese officer he is fixated on is still alive. Fact-based drama, starring Colin Firth, Nicole Kidman and Stellan Skarsgard

programme.title: We Need to Talk About Cosby
programme.desc: Documentary by W Kamau Bell offering a deeply personal exploration of actor and comedian Bill Cosby's descent from 'America's Dad' to alleged sexual predator, talking to comedians, educators, journalists and survivors to have a conversation about the man and his crimes. He begins by looking at the 1960s, when Cosby was collecting accolades for his comedy and finding his own ways of participating in the nation's civil rights movement, but all the while he was allegedly beginning to exploit his power.

programme.title: Interior Design Masters
programme.desc: Ten aspiring designers compete in the makeover challenge, hoping to get their big break in the world of commercial interior design. Michelle Ogundehin asks them to transform five luxury apartments in London's Elephant and Castle and they must work in pairs, with one in charge of the open-plan kitchen-living room, while the other takes control of the bedrooms. Alan Carr hosts

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts and the team explore two unusual properties about to be auctioned in Kent and Yorkshire, plus a large Victorian end terrace in Greater Manchester

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: Nigel Havers hosts as five dealers battle each other to buy items brought in by the public. Items presented include a Middle Eastern rice warmer, a kingfisher-decorated vase, a large hop sieve, a Victorian-style port pourer and a solid oak harmonium

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Another look back at some highlights from the show, as Monty Don demonstrates how almost anything that holds soil and drains water can be used to grow seasonal veg, salad crops and herbs. Frances Tophill visits some hardy gardeners on the Isle of Man whose beachfront plots are at the constant mercy of the sea, and Arit Anderson meets a woman on a mission to 'green up' neglected urban spaces

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: King of Kings (1961)
programme.desc: Biblical epic chronicling the life of Christ, from the rumours of a coming Messiah before his birth, through his rise as a spiritual leader to his eventual betrayal, crucifixion and resurrection. Narrated by Orson Welles and starring Jeffrey Hunter, Siobhan McKenna, Robert Ryan, Rip Torn, Hurd Hatfield and Harry Guardino

programme.title: Talking Pictures
programme.desc: A retrospective look at TV appearances made over the years by American actor and director Orson Welles, capturing the milestones and highlights of his life and career. Narrated by Sylvia Syms.

programme.title: Jill Halfpenny's Easter Journeys
programme.desc: Part one of two. The actress explores how ancient Christian paths crisscrossed the north-east of England and Scottish Borders, inspiring unique traditions and customs, many of which are still celebrated at Easter. She visits the historic town of Hexham, joining bellringers in the Abbey and having a go herself, and enjoys the Hexham Abbey Choir as its members rehearse a favourite Easter hymn - This Joyful Eastertide. In Lauder, Jill meets a local horseman who explains the tradition of riding the parish boundary, an annual much-loved traditional event

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers' Pubs That Built Britain
programme.desc: Si and Dave are in Glasgow, discovering pubs with a link to the city's shipbuilding industry. They meet former shipyard workers to hear what pub life was like when the whistles blew, Si tries his hand at welding, and the duo celebrate the city's illustrious past with some cocktail-making in a bar said to be styled on the Clyde-built ship, The Queen Mary

programme.title: The Big Painting Challenge
programme.desc: Mariella Frostrup and Richard Coles present the final from Chatham's historic dockyards, where the artists must paint a self-portrait for their first challenge. The finalists then receive individual masterclasses in the areas coaches Diana Ali and Pascal Anson feel they need help, which involves everything from painting with rollers to working blindfolded. In the final round, the contestants have a free hand to paint whatever they choose to impress judges Daphne Todd and Lachlan Goudie, before one of them is named this year's winner

programme.title: My Unique B&B
programme.desc: Simon Parfett and his team help Nigel and Maria, who inherited a 400-year-old farm near Cullompton in Devon. They now want to convert a 1970s showman's caravan into a hostelry

programme.title: Your Home Made Perfect
programme.desc: Laura Jane Clark and Robert Jamison create virtual reality renovations for a couple's home in Margate. The property was originally a B&B, and the transition to a home has not been entirely successful. It is poorly laid out, has too many rooms, and while big on floor space is lacking natural light. Laura sets out to return the building to its early 20th-century roots, whole Robert comes up with a radically different way of using the living space

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Paul Martin visits the Watts Gallery in the heart of the Surrey countryside, where experts David Harper and Thomas Plant are on hand to find a selection of objects to take to auction. David uncovers a collection of British film and TV memorabilia and Thomas is thrilled by some French cameo glass. Paul is on the trail of Martians in Woking, the setting for HG Wells's sci-fi novel The War of the Worlds

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Kemah Bob, JJ Chalmers, Kevin Clifton and Victoria Derbyshire test their general knowledge skills in the hope of winning a prize, with the week's overall winner being decided

programme.title: Coast to Coast Food Festival
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher finds tips and treats among the food producers in Cardiff Market, from making Indian street food to baking vegan cakes. Farmer Jim Smith is near Inverness, discovering the story behind every bag of carrots, and the process of making a healthy South African protein snack is revealed. Food journalist Leyla Kazim investigates our love of the pre-packed sandwich

programme.title: Iolo's Borderlands
programme.desc: Iolo Williams explores Monmouthshire, looks for a rare bee on the Gwent Levels and finds fallow deer in the Wye Valley, as well as a heavily camouflaged bird near Abergavenny. Iolo ends this portion of his journey at Llanthony Priory, where house martins are nesting in the ruins

programme.title: Beechgrove Garden
programme.desc: The gardening programme returns, with Carole Baxter, George Anderson and Diana Yates assessing the state of the garden after winter and starting the many jobs that need done at this time of year. Calum Clunie reports from his allotment in Leven, while Brian Cunningham provides an update on his garden at Old Scone and there are also tips to save money in the garden

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don adds some interest to the spring garden. He also sows peas and shallots, has some thrifty tips for petunias, and plants lilies in pots. Carol Klein visits Mothecombe Gardens in Devon, which has been designed specifically for pollinators. Arit Anderson joins a group of young carers at a community garden in West Sussex, where they go for respite, friendship and fun

programme.title: Pilgrimage
programme.desc: Seven well known personalities with differing faiths and beliefs, meet in northern Portugal to tackle a modern-day Catholic pilgrimage. Taking part are actresses Su Pollard and Rita Simons, Shane Lynch of Boyzone fame, reality TV star Vicky Pattison, TV personality Bobby Seagull, comedian Nabil Abdulrashid and Paralympian skier Millie Knight

programme.title: The Hundred-Foot Journey (2014)
programme.desc: An Indian family emigrates to a village in the South of France to open a restaurant. A bitter feud erupts with the proprietor of a restaurant just across the road, while romance blossoms between the son of the newcomers and their rival's sous chef. Comedy drama based on the novel by Richard C Morais, starring Helen Mirren, Om Puri, Manish Dayal and Charlotte Le Bon

programme.title: MOTDx
programme.desc: Jermaine Jenas and the team reveal more of the lifestyle and culture that surrounds the Premier League and those involved in it

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig celebrates the 100th birthday of the BBC, with Zoe Lyons, Greg James, Richard Osman and Alan Davies

programme.title: Get on Up: The Triumph of Black America
programme.desc: David Harewood takes viewers from the birth of hip-hop in the early 1980s to the present day. He explores how a new generation of producers and performers increasingly began to own their 'creative capital', and became billionaires with lifestyles to match. David also examines the influence of hip-hop on 90s film with director Allen Hughes, and meets Black Panther star Florence Kasumba

programme.title: The Drug Wars that Killed Olivia
Parole
programme.desc: Facing the board in this edition are Ruben, who has been serving a sentence for biting a man's ear off, and Tom , who made close to a million pounds dealing cocaine. Mark disagrees with his sentence for threatening to kill and denies large portions of the crime that led him to prison. Will his desire to see his kids for Christmas be enough to convince the Board he deserves a second chance, or will his chequered past continue to dictate his future?

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo journeys through Thailand, stopping to help at a hospital for elephants wounded by landmines and visiting ruined temples in the former Siamese capital of Ayutthaya

programme.title: Canals: The Making of a Nation
programme.desc: Liz McIvor examines the Manchester Ship Canal, hailed as the greatest engineering feat of the Victorian age. Widely regarded as troublesome outsiders who led a drunken life of ungodly debauchery, the navvies who built it toiled in a time of rising trade unionism, prompting Liz to consider how well they managed to organise themselves in campaigning for the best possible deal

programme.title: Wonders of the Great Barrier Reef with Iolo Williams
programme.desc: The naturalist travels with a specialist dive team looking for signs of hope that the Great Barrier Reef can survive the threat of global warming. Invited on the journey by award-winning underwater cinematographer and marine biologist Richard Fitzpatrick, Iolo dives deep beneath the tranquil surface of the coral sea to discover what state this natural wonder is in

programme.title: The Fairytale Castles of King Ludwig II with Dan Cruickshank
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the aesthetic styles associated with Ludwig II of Bavaria, the king who was considered to be handsome and loved by his people. Dan Cruickshank investigates the mock-medievalism of Neuschwanstein castle and the complex design of Herrenchiemsee, to assess how they are key to learning more about the enigmatic ruler

programme.title: Elizabeth R
programme.desc: The queen meets an interesting suitor, the Duke of Anjou, much to the Puritans' disapproval. Now she must decide whether to follow her head or her heart. Award-winning drama chronicling the reign of Elizabeth I, starring Glenda Jackson, Ronald Hines, Robert Hardy, Stephen Murray and Bernard Horsfall

programme.title: Elizabeth R
programme.desc: The monarch's position is increasingly threatened by the imprisoned Mary, Queen of Scots and her loyal supporters, leaving Elizabeth to ponder Mary's fate. Starring Glenda Jackson, Vivian Pickles, David Collings and Stephen Murray

programme.title: Julius Caesar Revealed
programme.desc: Mary Beard sets out on a quest to uncover the real Julius Caesar, challenging the received popular view of the Roman politician and general. The classicist looks at how he become the autocratic ruler of Rome, the tactics of his military campaigns, his use of spin and PR on his way to the top, and the reasons behind his assassination on the Ides of March in 44 BC. The scholar also examines his surprising legacy right up to the present day, revealing how his influence is still shaping language, politics and people's everyday lives

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo journeys through Thailand, stopping to help at a hospital for elephants wounded by landmines and visiting ruined temples in the former Siamese capital of Ayutthaya

programme.title: Canals: The Making of a Nation
programme.desc: Liz McIvor examines the Manchester Ship Canal, hailed as the greatest engineering feat of the Victorian age. Widely regarded as troublesome outsiders who led a drunken life of ungodly debauchery, the navvies who built it toiled in a time of rising trade unionism, prompting Liz to consider how well they managed to organise themselves in campaigning for the best possible deal

programme.title: Wonders of the Great Barrier Reef with Iolo Williams
programme.desc: The naturalist travels with a specialist dive team looking for signs of hope that the Great Barrier Reef can survive the threat of global warming. Invited on the journey by award-winning underwater cinematographer and marine biologist Richard Fitzpatrick, Iolo dives deep beneath the tranquil surface of the coral sea to discover what state this natural wonder is in

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo visits the Thai capital of Bangkok, mid-way through his rail tour of the country, where he learns how the late-19th-century King Rama V built a grand palace and introduced railways to the country. He discovers the fine terminus commissioned by the king and meets a historian and designer, who shares family roots with the present royal dynasty. Michael also learns that King Rama V's love of steam engines was inspired by Queen Victoria

programme.title: Canals: The Making of a Nation
programme.desc: Liz McIvor explores the heritage of the canal network. After years of decline, the inland waterways were eventually restored to become places of leisure and tranquillity. Liz visits the Pontcysyllte Aqueduct in north Wales and travels to Birmingham where canals have become catalysts for property development and urban regeneration

programme.title: Jet! When Britain Ruled the Skies
programme.desc: Part two of two. The development of the UK's passenger airline industry following the Second World War, which by 1960 was the global leader and boasted routes stretching throughout the Empire. The aircraft used included the British-built Vickers Viscount and de Havilland Comet - the world's first passenger jet airliner, which could fly twice as high and fast as its predecessors. Narrated by Barbara Flynn

programme.title: High Society (1956)
programme.desc: Romantic complications arise when a playboy composer sets out to win back his ex-wife. However, she is about to marry another man - and the situation becomes even more difficult when a cynical reporter enters the fray. Musical comedy based on The Philadelphia Story with a score by Cole Porter, starring Bing Crosby, Frank Sinatra and Grace Kelly, with Louis Armstrong appearing as himself

programme.title: The Miracle of the Bells (1948)
programme.desc: Ailing aspiring actress Olga Treskovna dies before the premiere of her first feature film, and her smitten agent Bill Dunnigan agrees to take her body back to her hometown for burial, as per her last request. Olga's other final wish is for her movie to reach cinemas, despite opposition from studio executives, who are reluctant to introduce a new star who can no longer appear in other films. However, Olga hoped her starring role will help inspire the people of her down-at-heel hometown to seize control of their futures, and Bill teams up with local priest Father Paul to ensure Olga's legacy is fulfilled. Drama, starring Fred MacMurray, Alida Valli and Frank Sinatra

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo visits the Thai capital of Bangkok, mid-way through his rail tour of the country, where he learns how the late-19th-century King Rama V built a grand palace and introduced railways to the country. He discovers the fine terminus commissioned by the king and meets a historian and designer, who shares family roots with the present royal dynasty. Michael also learns that King Rama V's love of steam engines was inspired by Queen Victoria

programme.title: Canals: The Making of a Nation
programme.desc: Liz McIvor explores the heritage of the canal network. After years of decline, the inland waterways were eventually restored to become places of leisure and tranquillity. Liz visits the Pontcysyllte Aqueduct in north Wales and travels to Birmingham where canals have become catalysts for property development and urban regeneration

programme.title: Jet! When Britain Ruled the Skies
programme.desc: Part two of two. The development of the UK's passenger airline industry following the Second World War, which by 1960 was the global leader and boasted routes stretching throughout the Empire. The aircraft used included the British-built Vickers Viscount and de Havilland Comet - the world's first passenger jet airliner, which could fly twice as high and fast as its predecessors. Narrated by Barbara Flynn

programme.title: Armando's Tale of Charles Dickens
programme.desc: Satirist and lifelong Charles Dickens fan Armando Iannucci, worried that endless adaptations of the novelist's work have led his skills to go unappreciated, sets out to prove why he still matters as a writer in the 21st century. Using David Copperfield as a starting point, he unpicks the language and the revolution of a master storyteller, and with the help of funnymen Barry Cryer, Kevin Eldon and Phill Jupitus, he gets beneath the skin of some of the more outlandish characters. Finally, through encounters with the types of people Dickens wrote about, including lawyers and a debtor, Iannucci claims that his stories are just as relevant today

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Simon Mayo presents the chart show from June 23, 1994, featuring Aswad, Dawn Penn, Ace of Base, All-4-One, Shed Seven, the B-52's, Cappella, Elton John and Wet Wet Wet

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Bruno Brookes presents Juliet Roberts, Let Loose, Reel 2 Real with the Mad Stuntman, the Boomtown Rats, Oasis, Crystal Waters, These Animal Men, the Grid and Wet Wet Wet from June 30, 1994

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Simon Bates and Peter Powell present the pop chart programme from April 7, 1983, featuring Dexys Midnight Runners, Culture Club, JoBoxers, Twisted Sister, Michael Jackson, Tracie, FR David, Nick Heyward, Big Country and David Bowie

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Anthea Turner hosts the edition first aired on April 5, with performances by artists including Jason Donovan, They Might Be Giants, Happy Mondays, Madonna, Queen Latifah and De La Soul, Emma, UB40, Snap and Alannah Myles

programme.title: When Bob Marley Came to Britain
programme.desc: Documentary examining the reggae superstar's relationship with the UK, and how his universal message of One Love and unity helped inspire a generation of young black British people. The film also takes a revealing look at how Marley spent his time while he was in Britain - the houses he lived in, football kickabouts in Battersea Park, and visits to the UK's growing Rastafarian community, including secret gigs in the north of England

programme.title: Bob Marley Reimagined
programme.desc: A concert at Birmingham's Town Hall celebrating the reggae superstar, featuring songs including Get Up Stand Up, One Love/People Get Ready, Redemption Song, Satisfy My Soul, Is This Love, I Shot the Sheriff and Exodus. Trevor Nelson hosts, while the Chineke! orchestra is joined by Bob's grandson Skip Marley, singer-songwriter JP Cooper and singer Ruby Turner

programme.title: Reggae at the BBC
programme.desc: A celebration of reggae performances from the BBC archives, featuring footage from programmes including Top of the Pops, Old Grey Whistle Test and Later with Jools Holland. Acts include Bob Marley and the Wailers, Gregory Isaacs, Desmond Dekker, Burning Spear, Althea and Donna, Dennis Brown and Buju Banton

programme.desc: Simon Mayo presents the chart show from June 23, 1994, featuring Aswad, Dawn Penn, Ace of Base, All-4-One, Shed Seven, the B-52's, Cappella, Elton John and Wet Wet Wet

programme.title: Shaun the Sheep
programme.desc: A leak in the barn roof forces the flock to relocate to the sty, but the pigs do not want to share their space

programme.title: Danger Mouse
programme.desc: The plucky rodent faces the prospect of being forced out of his own show after Count Duckula kidnaps the writers and forces them to make him the star

programme.title: Boy Girl Dog Cat Mouse Cheese
programme.desc: When Cheese realizes she hasn't done half of what her idol, Posh, has accomplished, she tries to catch up by imitating everything Posh does - but things go very wrong.

programme.title: Newsround
programme.desc: Topical news magazine for children.

programme.title: Ninja Express
programme.desc: The Ninjas help a misunderstood horse find what he is looking for in a supermarket, while Konpeki competes in a TV singing competition.

programme.title: Danny & Mick
programme.desc: Danny and Mick are suffering from the heat and break the heating system trying to make themselves cooler. They turn the whole leisure centre into a freezing, icy and slippery wonderland. Can they fix it?

programme.title: Odd Squad
programme.desc: When Agent Obfusco's moustache is stolen, it is up to Olive and Otto to get it back

programme.title: Pokemon
programme.desc: Shaymin, Sandy, and Meltan get lost in Malie City while chasing after Mallow's lost hair ornament.

programme.title: Pokemon
programme.desc: Ash and his friends arrive at the Kanto Gym in Malie City, where they discover a group of ninja pokemon trainers.

programme.title: Taffy
programme.desc: There is a burglar in the neighborhood stealing meat. And aside from the burglar's mask, he looks exactly like Bentley! Taffy tries to get rid of Bentley by passing him off as the Masked Mutt at Mrs Muchmore's ball.

programme.title: Oswaldo
programme.desc: Leia invites Oswaldo to be her assistant during one of her boardgame-themed videocasts.

programme.title: Monster Loving Maniacs
programme.desc: A small paranormal disturbance escalates into a full-blown hamster exorcism ritual.

programme.title: Monster Loving Maniacs
programme.desc: In a battle for control of the TV, Arthur and the kids make a bet

programme.title: Deadly Predators
programme.desc: Steve Backshall goes in search of powerful predators, including a sea eagle that is an expert at lifting fish up to one third of its bodyweight out of the water

programme.desc: Charles Dickens sings about his life and books, and Vlad the Impaler reveals his horrible new plan for keeping out the neighbours

programme.title: The Next Step
programme.desc: Lily struggles to focus on dance, and Ozzy tries to find Richelle the perfect venue

programme.title: The Next Step
programme.desc: Kenzie auditions three dancers for the Nationals solo, but one of them challenges the Dance Captain Diary's wisdom

programme.title: The Next Step
programme.desc: Richelle and Shad try to convince Nick to invest in Step Inside

programme.title: Danger Mouse
programme.desc: DM must save his reputation and the world when Professor Squawkencluck's artificially intelligent defence supercomputer becomes power mad. With the voice of Alexander Armstrong

programme.title: Danger Mouse
programme.desc: DM has to face his only fear when Penfold accidentally wakes up a gigantic World Wide Spider

programme.title: Boy Girl Dog Cat Mouse Cheese
programme.desc: The family goes on a canoe trip, and Boy and Girl are each allowed to bring a friend. However, Boy realises he doesn't really have any friends outside his own family

programme.title: Boy Girl Dog Cat Mouse Cheese
programme.desc: Mum and Dad take a holiday, leaving Boy in charge of the house. However, his siblings are a little too eager to have fun and they totally ignore Boy's rules

programme.title: Dennis & Gnasher Unleashed!
programme.desc: JJ is convinced that Mrs Creecher is secretly a master of Blamjitsu, so she ersuades the gang to help trick her into revealing her blam credentials

programme.title: Dennis & Gnasher Unleashed!
programme.desc: Doctor Pfooflepfeffer covets the world-beating power of Gnasher's indestructible teeth.

programme.title: Matilda and the Ramsay Bunch
programme.desc: Dad Gordon, mum Tana, big brother Jack and sisters Megan and Holly touch down in Los Angeles and get very competitive from the word go. At the beach they meet an incredible surfing dog - a golden retriever called Ricochet, and Matilda and Jack get the chance to surf with her

programme.title: Matilda and the Ramsay Bunch
programme.desc: The Cookie Monster pays a surprise visit, so Matilda Ramsay gets his help and together they set to work making a giant chocolate-chip treat. The Ramsay Bunch has planned a drive-in movie night in the back garden, and as darkness falls its members set to work. Along with their friend Cruz Beckham they build the outdoor screen, while Matilda cooks margherita and pepperoni pizza with a rainbow salad. As well as cooking, Matilda makes a prank film and the whole family falls for her tricks - even dad Gordon

programme.title: Matilda and the Ramsay Bunch
programme.desc: Matilda Ramsay and the rest of the Ramsay Bunch set off on a road trip to the American Wild West. Their first stop is a cowboy ranch in the Nevada desert. At the ranch Matilda and her brother Jack, mum Tana and dad Gordon saddle up on horseback, learn how to ride horses like cowboys and get the chance to round up cattle - Wild West style. While the rest of the Ramsay Bunch learn how to use a lasso, Matilda prepares vegetable ratatouille parcels and marinated steaks, cooked on the campfire

programme.title: The Dumping Ground
programme.desc: Jody leads the search for the runaways, hoping to bring them back to the DG before Ben wakes up. But as Fraser leads the runaways on to his destination, a grave danger awaits

programme.desc: Featuring a party game inspired by LS Lowry

programme.title: Malory Towers
programme.desc: Darrell Rivers cannot wait for a fresh start on her first day at a new boarding school, but her past may come to haunt her. Drama based on the books by Enid Blyton

programme.title: The Deep
programme.desc: Trying to rescue Jess Gorman in an underwater cave proves dangerous for Ant and Fontaine.

programme.title: Danger Mouse
programme.desc: Danger Mouse faces the Queen of Weevils in a fearful Halloween special

programme.title: Dennis & Gnasher Unleashed!
programme.desc: Tricked into a town-wide clean-up, Dennis and Walter are paired up against their wills, but they are forced to co-operate to survive in the wilderness of Beanotown Woods

programme.desc: Youth activist Anita takes us on a journey to show the impact fast fashion has on our world. She is determined that fashion can be sustainable. Our 'buy and throw away' culture contributes to the global warming crisis so something has to be done. In a vivid animated world, we learn about the journey that many of our clothes make; from where they are manufactured, all the way to how they are transported to the UK high streets - but are there other alternatives when buying our clothes? Anita sets out to explore sustainable solutions for young people. She talks to environmentalist Zaqiya about her school initiative, Swop it Up, and Holly, manager of the UK's largest charity shop. Together they show us ways young people can buy fashionable clothes and look after the planet at the same time.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Jay Blades and his team of experts welcome Rokeya and Patricia into the Repair Shop who have brought in a painting that has been in their family since it was commissioned in the early 1950s. Kirsten Ramsay takes on the challenge of repairing a clay keepsake of Emese and Luke's son's footprints. David, who died at just five months old, was diagnosed with a rare heart condition in 2020 and the clay has already started to crack. Nick and Pat from West Yorkshire bring in a thermometer that was used to measure extreme temperatures when they lived in the Arctic. The last visitor of the day is Bekki, who brings the remains of an antique glass and lead terrarium that has been completely destroyed after being couriered from Spain to her home after her grandparents died

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc: The five pairs leave Dawson City and head south to the third checkpoint, 2,700km away in Alberta but the stakes are raised as the team who reach the destination last will be eliminated. Race leaders Trisha and Cathie enjoy a 25-hour lead over their nearest competitors but after hiring a car in the last leg they take a risk on car sharing their way to Alberta. Disaster strikes for Monique who injures herself at the checkpoint causing her and father Ladi a further three-hour delay. Zainib and Mobeen formulate a new strategy and Marc has to face his fears. Forty-five hours behind Trisha and Cathie are Claudia and Kevin, sitting in last place with their no-frills strategy

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Highlights of this evening's Premier League fixtures, featuring Manchester United v Brentford at Old Trafford and West Ham United v Newcastle United at London Stadium. United were looking to avenge a 4-0 defeat at the hands of Brentford in August. West Ham held Newcastle to a draw when the teams met two months ago, but both teams were in need of a win this time around for differing reasons. Plus, action from last night's contests, which were Chelsea v Liverpool, Bournemouth v Brighton & Hove Albion, Leeds United v Nottingham Forest and Leicester City v Aston Villa

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc: Former world champion boxer Anthony Crolla, sport broadcaster Eilidh Barbour, Commonwealth gold medal winning netballer Eboni Usoro-Brown and Scottish rugby star Adam Hastings join team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness on the quiz

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars
programme.desc: The acerbic chef resumes his search for the country's most exciting and innovative new food and drink business, hand-picking 12 of the UK's best up-and-coming food and drink entrepreneurs to compete to earn an investment - 150,000 of his own money. He starts by inviting the contenders to Glenapp Castle, where he tasks them with creating banquets celebrating his birth-place - Scotland. Will they thrive under pressure or crumble as members of the Edinburgh Royal Military Tattoo, no less, sit down to feast?

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: The Moment of Proof
programme.desc: How a USB stick found in the raid of a woman's house led to the downfall of her online drugs empire. Plus, the way in which police targeted the man responsible for converted weapons flooding the UK. Narrated by Chuku Modu

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: The park may finally get its first emu chick, though the keepers beed to persuade the male emu to sit on the eggs. Elsewhere, it's touch-and-go again with the rock hyrax babies, while Kate Humble spots a wild white-tailed sea eagle visiting the park and Jean Johansson helps out with a moth survey

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts and Martel Maxwell check out a house in Maidstone, Kent, a flat in North Shields, Tyneside, and an office with planning permission for a flat above it in Bognor Regis, West Sussex

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin Sharp presents the competition from Heanor Antiques Centre in Derbyshire, where two teams are guided by experts Catherine Southon and Thomas Forrester as they try to find three interesting items that might generate a profit at auction on a budget of 300 each. Natasha monitors their progress and also takes a historic look at the semi-precious gemstone Blue John

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Nina and Suni prepare for a visit from Auntie Binita, while Luca invites Scarlett over for dinner. Two days before the wedding, the big day is thrown into jeopardy when the father of one of the grooms, drops a bombshell

programme.title: Virtually Home
programme.desc: A retired couple in Uxbridge, west London, call on the help of interior designer Simon Hamilton and the Virtual Reality studio for advice on how to redesign their tired living room. They have very different views when it comes to colour and style, but will immersing them in the space using cutting-edge virtual reality technology mean they can feel comfortable about which way to go?

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman looks for a period property in rural West Sussex suitable for a couple with a toddler. She also tries her hand at the rare art of fore-edge painting

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: Nigel Havers hosts as five dealers battle each other to buy items brought in by the public. Items presented include a Middle Eastern rice warmer, a kingfisher-decorated vase, a large hop sieve, a Victorian-style port pourer and a solid oak harmonium

programme.title: Unbeatable
programme.desc: Over three rounds, contestants vie to find the single 'unbeatable' answer and streak ahead of the rest to make the final where they can win a cash prize. General knowledge quiz, hosted by Jason Manford

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Hosted by Alexander Armstrong and Ed Gamble

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: Party Election Broadcast
programme.desc: By the Liberal Democrats

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Scott and Gethin Jones host the live magazine show featuring a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Kim and Denise continue to try and break up Chelsea and Ravi regardless of what he says but the pair are thrown off when she supports him over them. Freddie is proud of himself for standing up to Mr Hawthorne

programme.title: Reunion Hotel
programme.desc: Alex Jones gives people a chance to be reunited with someone pivotal from their past, beginning with 21-year-old Tegan, whose life was saved by a stranger after she fell onto a London Underground track. Cameras also follow Lee, who hopes to meet his brother for the first time, and Pippa, a youngster who wants to thank volunteers for a life-changing home improvement which helped ease her rare skin condition

programme.title: Dragons' Den
programme.desc: A child-friendly sunscreen applicator and a hard-water shower filter are demonstrated, and a collectable whisky company offers an interesting guarantee to self-made millionaires Peter Jones, Deborah Meaden, Touker Suleyman, Sara Davies and Steven Bartlett. Presented by Evan Davis

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars
programme.desc: Gordon invites his 11 contenders to Anglesey, north Wales, to test their raw skills and pure talent. After an expert masterclass on seaweed, the teams must precisely identify and harvest samples of the sustainable crop. Up against the tides, they need to traverse the rocks, to prove they can follow instructions. Next, Gordon tests the contenders' ability to run a business in Wales' glorious 'Little Italy' by the sea, Portmeirion. He asks the teams to create and sell pizzas to locals and tourists - whichever team takes the most money wins. Finally, it's crunch-time as the contenders come face to face with the acerbic chef

programme.title: Love, Faith and Me
programme.desc: Tattoo artist Alex and social worker Amy live in Sunderland and have five children under the age of five, including identical triplets. They anticipate that their Christian faith, family and community can help them juggle a chaotic home-life now that they're both back to work and the toddlers are getting more and more active

programme.title: A Very British Cult
programme.desc: Catrin Nye and her team expose control, intimidation and fear at a mysterious life coaching company that allegedly takes over people's lives and rips families apart. As the investigation heats up, the group fights back and there's a surreal final showdown

programme.title: Celebrity Mastermind
programme.desc: Journalist John Pienaar, lead singer of Britpop band Shed Seven, Rick Witter, comedian Suzi Ruffell, and actor Dakota Blue Richards are in the famous black chair, answering Clive Myrie's questions on Clement Attlee, the Smiths, the films of Sandra Bullock, and the music of Lana Del Rey

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: The Moment of Proof
programme.desc: How a fax led police to a shipping container smuggling a significant amount of drugs into the UK. Plus, how a cheque for a mattress linked a killer to a body found at a football stadium. Narrated by Chuku Modu

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: It's the 10th anniversary of the arrival of Anne, one of Europe's oldest elephants who spent most of her life in the circus. Kate and Ben find out the lengths the keepers go to in order to maintain her in the best condition possible. Plus, wildlife photographer Hamza Yassin witnesses some unique tiger behaviour and Jean Johansson lends the keepers a hand feeding the koalas

programme.title: My Life at Easter with Sally Phillips
programme.desc: Part one of two. Sally meets writer and broadcaster Gyles Brandreth to discover how Easter has informed a life filled with love, faith, politics and pantomime. Gyles's story takes him from family Easter egg hunts and searching for the secrets of happiness through to the paradox of combining a love of frivolity and light entertainment with a political career. For once, Gyles is lost for words as he discusses his blessings on an emotional spring walk with the host

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Danny Sebastian hosts the show from Eccleston, Lancashire, and visits Astley Hall in Chorley to learn about some intriguing furniture. With experts Izzie Balmer and Colin Young

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Hope Street
programme.desc: When a car is pulled from Port Devine Harbour, the whole town searches for a missing taxi driver whose daughter claims she was about to start a new life in England. So why would she drive her car into the sea? Meanwhile, Al's efforts to pay off his blackmailer lead him to desperate measures - which results in him kissing someone he shouldn't

programme.title: Virtually Home
programme.desc: A couple in Glasgow who have been living together for just a year, call on the help of interior designer Karen Livingstone Welstead, and the Virtual Reality studio for advice on how to revamp their living room that has a distinctly studenty feel. They have very different views when it comes to style, so hope using cutting-edge virtual reality technology will give them a better idea of what to do

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: A health-conscious couple from London enlist Sonali Shah to help them spend 1.3million on a detached property in Surrey with enough land to create a wellness retreat

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: Nigel Havers hosts as five dealers battle each other to buy items brought in by the public. Jill presents an English mid-century teddy bear that she's had for 66 years, Andrew appears with an early 19th-century copper ale mull, Sa offers up a decorative clock, while Bill showcases an old printing block that he thinks has the 'wow' factor

programme.title: Unbeatable
programme.desc: Over three rounds, contestants vie to find the single 'unbeatable' answer and streak ahead of the rest to make the final where they can win a cash prize. General knowledge quiz, hosted by Jason Manford

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Hosted by Alexander Armstrong and Ed Gamble

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Clara Amfo and Gethin Jones host an Easter-themed edition, with celebrity guests and stories about people in extraordinary circumstances

programme.title: The Weakest Link
programme.desc: Romesh Ranganathan invites John Robins, James Haskell, Bobby Seagull, Amanda Abbington, Sarah Kendall, Des Clarke, Yinka Bokinni and Su Pollard to bank money for chosen charities as they answer questions against the clock, blocking out rivals at the end of each round

programme.title: Beyond Paradise
programme.desc: Reeling from Martha's decision, Humphrey focuses his attentions on an inexplicable crime. A house has been burgled and all forensic evidence points to one suspect only. The only problem is that this suspect was locked up by Kelby in the station's police cell. With the arrival of the suspect's hardnosed lawyer, the team is under pressure to get results but with Humphrey distracted, it falls to Esther to take the lead on this investigation and crack the case. Meanwhile, despite her mother's protestations, Martha remains firm, however painful it might be. Detective drama, starring Kris Marshall and Sally Bretton

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Material from the comedy panel show, not originally shown in the series 16 episodes. Hosted by Rob Brydon, with team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack joined by celebrity guests including Bob Mortimer, Shirley Ballas, Josie Gibson, Chris McCausland, Bez, Motsi Mabuse, Shazia Mirza, Steve Pemberton, Munya Chawawa, Alice Roberts, Snoochie Shy, Chizzy Akudolu, Simon Gregson, Henning Wehn, Jayde Adams, Laurence Llewelyn-Bowen, Ellie Simmonds and Mist

programme.title: The Cleaner
programme.desc: Wicky is called to a shooting in a technology shop, where he finds himself sharing the night shift with a shelf-stacking conspiracy theorist who is preparing for the end of the world - which he insists is just around the corner. Wicky isn't sure whether the man is paranoid or just being sensible, but either way he has to decide where his own priorities lie. Dark comedy, starring Greg Davies, with Asim Chaudhry

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Avengers: Age of Ultron (2015)
programme.desc: The superhero team faces a threat from within when Iron Man creates an artificial intelligence to take their place protecting the world. The android grows resentful of his creators, and decides his mission is best accomplished by wiping out the human race. Meanwhile, two vengeful superpowered twins seek to turn the Avengers against each other. Sci-fi adventure sequel, starring Robert Downey Jr, Chris Hemsworth, Chris Evans and Scarlett Johansson

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: The Moment of Proof
programme.desc: A blood-spattered hammer helps detectives solve a vicious murder. A drug dealing-gang is brought to its knees when detectives focus on how the product is packaged to catch them

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: A mysterious illness appears to be stopping the rock hyrax mum from feeding her babies, and there are some arrivals who have been missing since the mid-19th century - red squirrels

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martel Maxwell, Martin Roberts and Dion Dublin chart the progress of a Methodist church in Dover in Kent, a cottage in Belper in Derbyshire and an end terrace in Jump near Barnsley

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Caroline Hawley and Ochuko Ojiri help two teams at Epsom racecourse in Surrey, while Eric Knowles challenges the crowds to guess the function of an intriguing wooden object

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Ollie makes a decision while Emma tries to get Rob to open up. Al meets a Chinese student who seems to be homesick, but he's sure there's something else going on

programme.title: Virtually Home
programme.desc: A couple cannot agree what to do with their Norfolk living room and snug area, so Russell Sage comes up with two virtual reality designs to help settle their differences

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin makes his way to Lincolnshire to assist a pair of expats who have a 300,000 budget to make the big return home after 11 years living abroad in Cyprus. Whilst in one of the country's largest agricultural counties, Jonnie also pays a visit to a land-based college to find out about the changing face of farming practices with the next generation of farmers

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: Nigel Havers hosts at five sets of sellers bring their precious items to the Bidding Room. The dealers bid for a pair of cherub wall lights, a collection of miniature Ferrari cars, an early 1900's brass microscope, a pair of carved mirrors and a light up grocer's sign

programme.title: Unbeatable
programme.desc: Jason Manford presents the general knowledge quiz in which four contestants compete over three rounds to find a single 'unbeatable' answer and streak ahead of the rest to make the final where they can win a cash prize

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Ed Gamble

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Emma Willis and Jermaine Jenas host the magazine show, with stories of interest from around the UK, plus celebrity guests in the studio

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Kim and Denise try to break up Ravi and Chelsea, but Ravi has other plans. Callum receives an urgent work call that changes things for the people on the square and Freddie confronts his old teacher

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Jay Blades and his team of experts welcome Rokeya and Patricia into the Repair Shop who have brought in a painting that has been in their family since it was commissioned in the early 1950s. Kirsten Ramsay takes on the challenge of repairing a clay keepsake of Emese and Luke's son's footprints. David, who died at just five months old, was diagnosed with a rare heart condition in 2020 and the clay has already started to crack. Nick and Pat from West Yorkshire bring in a thermometer that was used to measure extreme temperatures when they lived in the Arctic. The last visitor of the day is Bekki, who brings the remains of an antique glass and lead terrarium that has been completely destroyed after being couriered from Spain to her home after her grandparents died

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc: The five pairs leave Dawson City and head south to the third checkpoint, 2,700km away in Alberta but the stakes are raised as the team who reach the destination last will be eliminated. Race leaders Trisha and Cathie enjoy a 25-hour lead over their nearest competitors but after hiring a car in the last leg they take a risk on car sharing their way to Alberta. Disaster strikes for Monique who injures herself at the checkpoint causing her and father Ladi a further three-hour delay. Zainib and Mobeen formulate a new strategy and Marc has to face his fears. Forty-five hours behind Trisha and Cathie are Claudia and Kevin, sitting in last place with their no-frills strategy

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Highlights of this evening's Premier League fixtures, featuring Manchester United v Brentford at Old Trafford and West Ham United v Newcastle United at London Stadium. United were looking to avenge a 4-0 defeat at the hands of Brentford in August. West Ham held Newcastle to a draw when the teams met two months ago, but both teams were in need of a win this time around for differing reasons.
