Wicky isn't sure whether the man is paranoid or just being sensible, but either way he has to decide where his own priorities lie. Dark comedy, starring Greg Davies, with Asim Chaudhry

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Avengers: Age of Ultron (2015)
programme.desc: The superhero team faces a threat from within when Iron Man creates an artificial intelligence to take their place protecting the world. The android grows resentful of his creators, and decides his mission is best accomplished by wiping out the human race. Meanwhile, two vengeful superpowered twins seek to turn the Avengers against each other. Sci-fi adventure sequel, starring Robert Downey Jr, Chris Hemsworth, Chris Evans and Scarlett Johansson

programme.title: A View from the Terrace
programme.desc: Craig G Telfer, Craig Fowler, Shaughan McGuigan, Robert Borthwick and Joel Sked present a sideways look at Scottish football, dissecting the ins and outs of the week's action, with a variety of features covering the full spectrum from the giants to the minnows

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: The Moment of Proof
programme.desc: A blood-spattered hammer helps detectives solve a vicious murder. A drug dealing-gang is brought to its knees when detectives focus on how the product is packaged to catch them

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: A mysterious illness appears to be stopping the rock hyrax mum from feeding her babies, and there are some arrivals who have been missing since the mid-19th century - red squirrels

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martel Maxwell, Martin Roberts and Dion Dublin chart the progress of a Methodist church in Dover in Kent, a cottage in Belper in Derbyshire and an end terrace in Jump near Barnsley

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Caroline Hawley and Ochuko Ojiri help two teams at Epsom racecourse in Surrey, while Eric Knowles challenges the crowds to guess the function of an intriguing wooden object

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Ollie makes a decision while Emma tries to get Rob to open up. Al meets a Chinese student who seems to be homesick, but he's sure there's something else going on

programme.title: Virtually Home
programme.desc: A couple cannot agree what to do with their Norfolk living room and snug area, so Russell Sage comes up with two virtual reality designs to help settle their differences

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin makes his way to Lincolnshire to assist a pair of expats who have a 300,000 budget to make the big return home after 11 years living abroad in Cyprus. Whilst in one of the country's largest agricultural counties, Jonnie also pays a visit to a land-based college to find out about the changing face of farming practices with the next generation of farmers

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: Nigel Havers hosts at five sets of sellers bring their precious items to the Bidding Room. The dealers bid for a pair of cherub wall lights, a collection of miniature Ferrari cars, an early 1900's brass microscope, a pair of carved mirrors and a light up grocer's sign

programme.title: Unbeatable
programme.desc: Jason Manford presents the general knowledge quiz in which four contestants compete over three rounds to find a single 'unbeatable' answer and streak ahead of the rest to make the final where they can win a cash prize

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Ed Gamble

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Emma Willis and Jermaine Jenas host the magazine show, with stories of interest from around the UK, plus celebrity guests in the studio

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Kim and Denise try to break up Ravi and Chelsea, but Ravi has other plans. Callum receives an urgent work call that changes things for the people on the square and Freddie confronts his old teacher

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Jay Blades and his team of experts welcome Rokeya and Patricia into the Repair Shop who have brought in a painting that has been in their family since it was commissioned in the early 1950s. Kirsten Ramsay takes on the challenge of repairing a clay keepsake of Emese and Luke's son's footprints. David, who died at just five months old, was diagnosed with a rare heart condition in 2020 and the clay has already started to crack. Nick and Pat from West Yorkshire bring in a thermometer that was used to measure extreme temperatures when they lived in the Arctic. The last visitor of the day is Bekki, who brings the remains of an antique glass and lead terrarium that has been completely destroyed after being couriered from Spain to her home after her grandparents died

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc: The five pairs leave Dawson City and head south to the third checkpoint, 2,700km away in Alberta but the stakes are raised as the team who reach the destination last will be eliminated. Race leaders Trisha and Cathie enjoy a 25-hour lead over their nearest competitors but after hiring a car in the last leg they take a risk on car sharing their way to Alberta. Disaster strikes for Monique who injures herself at the checkpoint causing her and father Ladi a further three-hour delay. Zainib and Mobeen formulate a new strategy and Marc has to face his fears. Forty-five hours behind Trisha and Cathie are Claudia and Kevin, sitting in last place with their no-frills strategy

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: The House of Paisley
programme.desc: In a monumental moment for the people of Northern Ireland, the Rev Ian Paisley agreed to sharing power with his political enemies, Sinn Fein. But after spending a lifetime teaching his followers not to trust those who dealt with Republicans, he was met with huge backlash from his followers who saw his compromise as the ultimate betrayal

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Highlights of this evening's Premier League fixtures, featuring Manchester United v Brentford at Old Trafford and West Ham United v Newcastle United at London Stadium. United were looking to avenge a 4-0 defeat at the hands of Brentford in August. West Ham held Newcastle to a draw when the teams met two months ago, but both teams were in need of a win this time around for differing reasons. Plus, action from last night's contests, which were Chelsea v Liverpool, Bournemouth v Brighton & Hove Albion, Leeds United v Nottingham Forest and Leicester City v Aston Villa

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc: Former world champion boxer Anthony Crolla, sport broadcaster Eilidh Barbour, Commonwealth gold medal winning netballer Eboni Usoro-Brown and Scottish rugby star Adam Hastings join team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness on the quiz

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: The Moment of Proof
programme.desc: How a USB stick found in the raid of a woman's house led to the downfall of her online drugs empire. Plus, the way in which police targeted the man responsible for converted weapons flooding the UK. Narrated by Chuku Modu

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: The park may finally get its first emu chick, though the keepers beed to persuade the male emu to sit on the eggs. Elsewhere, it's touch-and-go again with the rock hyrax babies, while Kate Humble spots a wild white-tailed sea eagle visiting the park and Jean Johansson helps out with a moth survey

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts and Martel Maxwell check out a house in Maidstone, Kent, a flat in North Shields, Tyneside, and an office with planning permission for a flat above it in Bognor Regis, West Sussex

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin Sharp presents the competition from Heanor Antiques Centre in Derbyshire, where two teams are guided by experts Catherine Southon and Thomas Forrester as they try to find three interesting items that might generate a profit at auction on a budget of 300 each. Natasha monitors their progress and also takes a historic look at the semi-precious gemstone Blue John

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Nina and Suni prepare for a visit from Auntie Binita, while Luca invites Scarlett over for dinner. Two days before the wedding, the big day is thrown into jeopardy when the father of one of the grooms, drops a bombshell

programme.title: Virtually Home
programme.desc: A retired couple in Uxbridge, west London, call on the help of interior designer Simon Hamilton and the Virtual Reality studio for advice on how to redesign their tired living room. They have very different views when it comes to colour and style, but will immersing them in the space using cutting-edge virtual reality technology mean they can feel comfortable about which way to go?

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman looks for a period property in rural West Sussex suitable for a couple with a toddler. She also tries her hand at the rare art of fore-edge painting

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: Nigel Havers hosts as five dealers battle each other to buy items brought in by the public. Items presented include a Middle Eastern rice warmer, a kingfisher-decorated vase, a large hop sieve, a Victorian-style port pourer and a solid oak harmonium

programme.title: Unbeatable
programme.desc: Over three rounds, contestants vie to find the single 'unbeatable' answer and streak ahead of the rest to make the final where they can win a cash prize. General knowledge quiz, hosted by Jason Manford

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Hosted by Alexander Armstrong and Ed Gamble

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Scott and Gethin Jones host the live magazine show featuring a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Kim and Denise continue to try and break up Chelsea and Ravi regardless of what he says but the pair are thrown off when she supports him over them. Freddie is proud of himself for standing up to Mr Hawthorne

programme.title: Dragons' Den
programme.desc: A child-friendly sunscreen applicator and a hard-water shower filter are demonstrated, and a collectable whisky company offers an interesting guarantee to self-made millionaires Peter Jones, Deborah Meaden, Touker Suleyman, Sara Davies and Steven Bartlett. Presented by Evan Davis

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars
programme.desc: Gordon invites his 11 contenders to Anglesey, north Wales, to test their raw skills and pure talent. After an expert masterclass on seaweed, the teams must precisely identify and harvest samples of the sustainable crop. Up against the tides, they need to traverse the rocks, to prove they can follow instructions. Next, Gordon tests the contenders' ability to run a business in Wales' glorious 'Little Italy' by the sea, Portmeirion. He asks the teams to create and sell pizzas to locals and tourists - whichever team takes the most money wins. Finally, it's crunch-time as the contenders come face to face with the acerbic chef

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Love, Faith and Me
programme.desc: Tattoo artist Alex and social worker Amy live in Sunderland and have five children under the age of five, including identical triplets. They anticipate that their Christian faith, family and community can help them juggle a chaotic home-life now that they're both back to work and the toddlers are getting more and more active

programme.title: A Very British Cult
programme.desc: Catrin Nye and her team expose control, intimidation and fear at a mysterious life coaching company that allegedly takes over people's lives and rips families apart. As the investigation heats up, the group fights back and there's a surreal final showdown

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Comedian and writer Tom Allen, former Blue Peter presenter Sarah Greene, rugby star Ugo Monye and comedian Morgana Robinson join host Rob Brydon and regular captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the offbeat panel show. As usual, the participants set out to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible fibs about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory, through rounds such as Home Truths and Quick-fire Lies

programme.title: Celebrity Mastermind
programme.desc: Journalist John Pienaar, lead singer of Britpop band Shed Seven, Rick Witter, comedian Suzi Ruffell, and actor Dakota Blue Richards are in the famous black chair, answering Clive Myrie's questions on Clement Attlee, the Smiths, the films of Sandra Bullock, and the music of Lana Del Rey

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: The Moment of Proof
programme.desc: How a fax led police to a shipping container smuggling a significant amount of drugs into the UK. Plus, how a cheque for a mattress linked a killer to a body found at a football stadium. Narrated by Chuku Modu

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: It's the 10th anniversary of the arrival of Anne, one of Europe's oldest elephants who spent most of her life in the circus. Kate and Ben find out the lengths the keepers go to in order to maintain her in the best condition possible. Plus, wildlife photographer Hamza Yassin witnesses some unique tiger behaviour and Jean Johansson lends the keepers a hand feeding the koalas

programme.title: My Life at Easter with Sally Phillips
programme.desc: Part one of two. Sally meets writer and broadcaster Gyles Brandreth to discover how Easter has informed a life filled with love, faith, politics and pantomime. Gyles's story takes him from family Easter egg hunts and searching for the secrets of happiness through to the paradox of combining a love of frivolity and light entertainment with a political career. For once, Gyles is lost for words as he discusses his blessings on an emotional spring walk with the host

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Danny Sebastian hosts the show from Eccleston, Lancashire, and visits Astley Hall in Chorley to learn about some intriguing furniture. With experts Izzie Balmer and Colin Young

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Hope Street
programme.desc: When a car is pulled from Port Devine Harbour, the whole town searches for a missing taxi driver whose daughter claims she was about to start a new life in England. So why would she drive her car into the sea? Meanwhile, Al's efforts to pay off his blackmailer lead him to desperate measures - which results in him kissing someone he shouldn't

programme.title: Virtually Home
programme.desc: A couple in Glasgow who have been living together for just a year, call on the help of interior designer Karen Livingstone Welstead, and the Virtual Reality studio for advice on how to revamp their living room that has a distinctly studenty feel. They have very different views when it comes to style, so hope using cutting-edge virtual reality technology will give them a better idea of what to do

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: A health-conscious couple from London enlist Sonali Shah to help them spend 1.3million on a detached property in Surrey with enough land to create a wellness retreat

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: Nigel Havers hosts as five dealers battle each other to buy items brought in by the public. Jill presents an English mid-century teddy bear that she's had for 66 years, Andrew appears with an early 19th-century copper ale mull, Sa offers up a decorative clock, while Bill showcases an old printing block that he thinks has the 'wow' factor

programme.title: Unbeatable
programme.desc: Over three rounds, contestants vie to find the single 'unbeatable' answer and streak ahead of the rest to make the final where they can win a cash prize. General knowledge quiz, hosted by Jason Manford

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Hosted by Alexander Armstrong and Ed Gamble

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Clara Amfo and Gethin Jones host an Easter-themed edition, with celebrity guests and stories about people in extraordinary circumstances

programme.title: Farm to Feast: Best Menu Wins
programme.desc: With two semi-finalists already confirmed, Michelin star chef Danni Barry and food critic Joris Minne enjoy a chance to see what's on the menu when the five remaining contestants are faced with delicious fresh beetroot from Comber in Co Down and wild wood pigeon from Ardboe in Co Tyrone. The task is to turn them into a memorable menu for a mouth-watering meal - and that third place in the semi-final. Presented by Eamonn Holmes

programme.title: The Weakest Link
programme.desc: Romesh Ranganathan invites John Robins, James Haskell, Bobby Seagull, Amanda Abbington, Sarah Kendall, Des Clarke, Yinka Bokinni and Su Pollard to bank money for chosen charities as they answer questions against the clock, blocking out rivals at the end of each round

programme.title: Beyond Paradise
programme.desc: Reeling from Martha's decision, Humphrey focuses his attentions on an inexplicable crime. A house has been burgled and all forensic evidence points to one suspect only. The only problem is that this suspect was locked up by Kelby in the station's police cell. With the arrival of the suspect's hardnosed lawyer, the team is under pressure to get results but with Humphrey distracted, it falls to Esther to take the lead on this investigation and crack the case. Meanwhile, despite her mother's protestations, Martha remains firm, however painful it might be. Detective drama, starring Kris Marshall and Sally Bretton

programme.title: The Cleaner
programme.desc: Wicky is called to a shooting in a technology shop, where he finds himself sharing the night shift with a shelf-stacking conspiracy theorist who is preparing for the end of the world - which he insists is just around the corner. Wicky isn't sure whether the man is paranoid or just being sensible, but either way he has to decide where his own priorities lie. Dark comedy, starring Greg Davies, with Asim Chaudhry

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Keepin' 'Er Country: On the Road Again
programme.desc: Jimmy Buckley has been singing and performing for over 20 years and has built up a loyal fanbase. Daughter Claudia is still a relative newcomer to the scene, but already she's showing that country music talent runs in the family. Both take to the stage at the annual Clonmany Festival in Donegal, as fans both old and new turn the main street into a massive dance floor. Well aware of the significance of the occasion, Jimmy and Claudia are determined to put on an amazing show for their fans

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Material from the comedy panel show, not originally shown in the series 16 episodes. Hosted by Rob Brydon, with team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack joined by celebrity guests including Bob Mortimer, Shirley Ballas, Josie Gibson, Chris McCausland, Bez, Motsi Mabuse, Shazia Mirza, Steve Pemberton, Munya Chawawa, Alice Roberts, Snoochie Shy, Chizzy Akudolu, Simon Gregson, Henning Wehn, Jayde Adams, Laurence Llewelyn-Bowen, Ellie Simmonds and Mist

programme.title: Avengers: Age of Ultron (2015)
programme.desc: The superhero team faces a threat from within when Iron Man creates an artificial intelligence to take their place protecting the world. The android grows resentful of his creators, and decides his mission is best accomplished by wiping out the human race. Meanwhile, two vengeful superpowered twins seek to turn the Avengers against each other. Sci-fi adventure sequel, starring Robert Downey Jr, Chris Hemsworth, Chris Evans and Scarlett Johansson

programme.title: rain CBeebies
programme.desc: A selection of crofting songs from Carrie, Linda, Ruairidh and the CBeebies ALBA presenters

programme.title: Pip & Posy
programme.desc: When the night is perfect to look for falling stars, Pip and Posy camp out in the garden, but Posy has very little patience. Pip shows her how it can be fun

programme.title: Stiridh
programme.desc: Alasdair MacLennan reads Uair a bha Siud air Adharc Aon-adharcach, written and illustrated by Beatrice Blue and translated into Gaelic by Morag Stewart

programme.desc: Shifu's father visits the Jade Palace, but Po is disappointed to learn that he and his son do not get along

programme.title: Uaine
programme.desc: Calum is on the outskirts of Glasgow to find out more about wind power

programme.title: Geamaichean Gorach
programme.desc: Stand aside as they are diving today and it is going to be messy

programme.title: Na Dana-thursan aig Tintin/The Adventures of Tintin
programme.desc: There's a secret attached to the old model boats and especially the pieces of an old treasure map, which was hidden inside them

programme.title: Dealbhan Fraoich (Heather's Portraits)
programme.desc: Heather Dewar travels to Inveraray to meet and draw a charcoal portrait of singer-songwriter Ethel MacCallum

programme.title: Cidsin Granaidh Chalanais
programme.desc: Gregor visits his auntie Ann to find out more about cooking in the family and smokes his own fish to add a modern twist to grannie's fishcake recipe

programme.title: Cold War Hockey
programme.desc: Documentary telling the story of when Scotland's women's hockey team was invited to play against West Germany in Berlin in September 1961. It was just weeks after the Berlin Wall had been constructed, and as former players recall, many of them feared the world was on the brink of war

programme.title: FUNC
programme.desc: Comedy sketch show. From President Trump calling his cousin in Lewis, to radio shows with a rude twist to the Zebras trying to board Noah's Ark, FUNC takes a comic swipe at the Gaelic and non-Gaelic world

programme.title: Women's Sport 360
programme.desc: Iona Ballantyne presents the show that gets to the heart of remarkable women and empowering stories in Scottish sport

programme.title: Tuaman Na h-Eiphit/Tombs of Egypt
programme.desc: After three months of excavations and dozens of sarcophagi found, more surprises lie in store for this team of Egyptian scientists. Having given up hope, they at last find a stone sarcophagus that apparently belongs to a vizier who lived during the New Kingdom

programme.desc: Kit and Pup investigate the world of magnets

programme.desc: Some of Tusk's friends say his home isn't cosy enough, so Tusk decides to throw a midsummer's Christmas party to prove them wrong

programme.title: Shane an Chef
programme.desc: Maggie acquires an unusual vegetable for Shane to cook with - but it is so strange, that Mario and Jay are convinced it has come from outer space

programme.title: Oscar & Ealasaid
programme.desc: Objects are disappearing all over town - Clestine's notebook, Bolro's hat, Mrs Tupile's binoculars and even the Green Mouse's cape. What's going on here?

programme.title: Su Pic (Peek Zoo)
programme.desc: When Mgr. Pc is giving a haircut to the gorilla on haircut day, things arent in perfect order for Violette

programme.desc: Sarah Cruickshank reads An Dragh a bh air Rbaidh, written and illustrated by Tom Percival and translated into Gaelic by Morag Stewart

programme.desc: The biggest sporting event in Grimsby the annual bog roll roll - takes place

programme.title: Alba Eagalach
programme.desc: The mystery of the lighthouse keepers who disappeared from the Flannan Isles, including a song from a couple of fishermen with their own unique take on events

programme.title: Clann Na Cruinne
programme.desc: Hikari gets advice on growing rice from Mr Yamanaka, who has been a rice farmer for over 50 years. She enjoys the process so much, she decides she wants to be a rice farmer when she grows up

programme.title: Damhan & Durrag/Pipas & Douglas
programme.desc: The magic is erupting from them today

programme.title: Proiseact Ploigh
programme.desc: Science and comedy, featuring contributions from expert Ishbel Murray, gag gangs from Tain, Harris and Skye with features on Pointillism, Vortex and a slinky laser

programme.title: Turas a' Bhradain
programme.desc: Neen Mackay visits the annual Salmon Festival in Inverness. She meets with female anglers who are fast becoming a major part of the world of fly fishing, and with passionate competitors in casting. With the salmon species now under serious threat, the programme also considers some of the scientific debates currently going on within the industry

programme.title: SpeakGaelic
programme.desc: Miriam Donaghey from the Isle of Lewis is Joy Dunlops guest in the studio, and Calum Maclean is in a park in Edinburgh as he tries an activity hes never heard of or tried before

programme.title: An L (News)
programme.desc: Local, national and international news and information from BBC Alba

programme.title: Na Tiristich (From Tiree with Love)
programme.desc: Life on Tiree, the most westerly island in the Inner Hebrides

programme.title: Dystonia: Beatha air Fhiaradh
programme.desc: For almost 40 years, DK MacPhee has lived with dystonia, which leaves him unable to straighten his head. DK gives an insight into the impact this has on his daily life and his ongoing battle to find treatment or relief. As his condition has deteriorated, with his head falling further to one side, the more his life has been affected. A number of years ago, he had to give up playing football, weekly, with his friends, something which he very much misses and he is determined to try and play again. Will this be possible?

programme.title: Seid a' Chidsin - The Kitchen Coves
programme.desc: Roddy makes squid stuffed with his own homemade Crappit Heid, while Uisdean makes fish stock which he uses in his three-fish speciality topped with Avgolemono sauce

programme.title: The Beetle, A Timeless Car
programme.desc: Fans of the Volkswagen Beetle discuss the car and its cult following, getting up close and personal with some restored and cherished models

programme.title: Dealbh is Slighe
programme.desc: Calum travels across Loch Awe to Kilchurn Castle, looking for the perfect light to take a special photo

programme.desc: Comedy sketch show. From President Trump calling his cousin in Lewis, to radio shows with a rude twist to the Zebras trying to board Noah's Ark, FUNC takes a comic swipe at the Gaelic and non-Gaelic world

programme.title: Live Women's International Football
programme.desc: Australia v Scotland (Kick-off 1.15pm). Coverage of the friendly fixture at the Cherry Red Records Stadium. With commentary by Derek MacKay and Joelle Murray

programme.title: Wallace & Gromit: A Grand Day Out (Cuairt Chaiseach)
programme.desc: Nick Park's Bafta-winning first film starring the animated heroes, who take a trip to the moon when their cheese supplies run out. With the voice of Peter Sallis

programme.title: Am BFG (The BFG) (1989)
programme.desc: A friendly giant befriends a lonely little girl and transports her to a strange land. Unfortunately, a number of the other giants there have acquired a taste for eating children. Determined to stop their nefarious habit, the pair set out to charm the Queen of England into putting her armed forces at their disposal. Animated adventure, based on Roald Dahl's classic tale, with the voices of Donald Smith, Catriona Lexy Campbell and Donna Morrison

programme.title: Treubh an Tuathanais (Big Barn Farm)
programme.desc: Goraidh and Muireall disagree over which of the two of them is bravest and, as a result of this, they arrange challenges to confirm, once and for all, who is worthy of the title

programme.title: Pip & Posy
programme.desc: When the night is perfect to look for falling stars, Pip and Posy camp out in the garden, but Posy has very little patience. Pip shows her how it can be fun

programme.title: Sionnach agus Maigheach (Fox & Hare)
programme.desc: Some of Tusk's friends say his home isn't cosy enough, so Tusk decides to throw a midsummer's Christmas party to prove them wrong

programme.title: Beathaichean a' Bocadaich
programme.desc: Sophie looks through her magic binoculars to find out how animals boogie

programme.title: AH-AH/No-No
programme.desc: There's an awful noise coming from Clags house - and a crazy, wayward rocket that needs to be brought under control. Perhaps it needs a few more adjustments

programme.title: rain CBeebies
programme.desc: A selection of crofting songs from Carrie, Linda, Ruairidh and the CBeebies ALBA presenters

programme.title: Stiridh
programme.desc: Calum Macaulay reads Uilebheistean Beaga by David Walliams, illustrated by Adam Stower and translated into Gaelic by Jo MacDonald

programme.title: Aithne air Ainmhidhean (All About Animals)
programme.desc: Interesting facts about members of the animal kingdom, focusing on a young moose called Matilda, who is able to feed underwater
An insight into D K Macphee's life at 12 years old

programme.title: Ronia, Nighean a' Mheirlich/Ronja, the Robber's Daughter
programme.desc: The robbers are thieving and the sheriff and the soldiers are in pursuit. However, sadness falls over them when Sgallan speaks to them for the last time

programme.title: An L (News)
programme.desc: Local, national and international news and information from BBC Alba

programme.title: Binneas
programme.desc: Music by Mischa Macpherson and friends

programme.title: Live Rugby Union
programme.desc: Ayrshire Bulls v Glasgow Warriors A (Kick-off 7.35pm). Coverage of the FOSROC Super Series match at the Caledonian Stadium in Inverness. Commentary by Hugh Dan MacLennan

programme.title: Fraochy Bay
programme.desc: Poet-in-residence Torquil Farquhar de Smith tries to capture the essence of Fraochy Bay in verse

programme.title: Fillte
programme.desc: A journey throughout Scotland to discover the history and contemporary hand-crafted practice behind the artisan production of woven fabrics, such as wool, hemp, linen, grasses, leather and many more unorthodox materials

programme.title: State of Happiness
programme.desc: Fredrik Nyman has to come up with a plan to save the factory, while Anna Hellevik sees an opportunity to help her father-in-law and starts scheming behind his back. Toril Torstensen gets help from an unexpected friend. In Norwegian and English

programme.title: Dealbh is Slighe
programme.desc: Calum travels across Loch Awe to Kilchurn Castle, looking for the perfect light to take a special photo

programme.title: Seirm
programme.desc: A diverse range of music with previously unseen performances from some of the artists that have appeared throughout the series. Mary Ann Kennedy presents

programme.title: Alba Today
programme.desc: BBC Alba joins Radio nan Gidheal, the BBC's Gaelic language radio service

programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Olivier Awards
programme.desc: Highlights of the ceremony celebrating the best of British theatre, with West End star Hannah Waddingham hosting at the Royal Albert Hall, where contenders included Jodie Comer, Paul Mescal, Beverley Knight, David Tennant, Rose Ayling-Ellis and Marisha Wallace. programme.title: Tonight
programme.desc: Seven million on the NHS waiting list means seven million stories of fading health, pain and the fear treatment may come too late. As experts warn of a deadly toll, record numbers have turned to private healthcare - both here and abroad. Emily Morgan meets some of those selling homes, taking loans and fundraising to buy back their health

programme.title: James Martin's French Adventure
programme.desc: The chef's culinary tour of France leads him to the diverse and distinct region of the Camargue, a natural region located south of Arles. James begins at Les Marquises, the Laurent family's farm, where he learns about the Camargue bull, and barbecues local fish for the family. Later, he visits a rice farm and cooks a risotto using his own rice-brewed beer

programme.desc: Alan takes a turn for the worse and, as the ambulance leaves, Steph searches his belongings, only to find she is not in his will

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Richard devises a plan to rid Audrey of her savings and the police descend on the factory, causing Joe to fear the worst

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Doreen and Derek disrupt baby Joshua's christening with their petty squabbles, Richard has a copy of Audrey's key made and Dev agrees to accompany Sunita to a friend's wedding

programme.title: Never the Twain
programme.desc: Like many good men before them, the feuding fathers fall out over a woman. Windsor Davies and Donald Sinden star

programme.title: Never the Twain
programme.desc: Though they may not seem like the world's best role models, Oliver and Simon are called on to offer fatherly advice. Comedy, starring Windsor Davies and Donald Sinden

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Simon Goddard's return from Australia worries the locals, but the former factory owner declares he is only visiting his daughter Amy. Kim enjoys the company of Alistair and his family, leaving Danny green with envy. Joe and Alice prepare to come clean about their relationship - until a bad-tempered Harding makes them change their mind

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: The locals are preoccupied with personal problems as Sally worries about her marriage, and Harding fears he is being undermined both at the factory and at home. Anna and David suspect Simon Goddard's activities in the town are not all they seem and a friendship is threatened by a former soldier's return. Rural drama, starring Thomas Craig, Samantha Giles and Brian Capron

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: A lavish dinner party proves to be a prelude to murder and intrigue - but fortunately Poirot is among the guests, and soon realises the key to the mystery lies in a duel fought 10 years previously. Drama, starring David Suchet, Caroline Langrishe and John McEnery

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Resident rogue Greengrass comes off worst in a car deal and responds by seizing goods from the local likely lad who took advantage of him - including a live python. Elsewhere, Mike investigates a case of food poisoning - and it seem a feud may be the cause of the trouble. Bill Maynard and Jason Durr star

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Steph prompts Alan to revise his will, but her relief is short-lived. Eric dupes Rodney into taking the fake antiques off his hands and Viv decides to replace her missing ring

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Alan calls Steph's bluff, while Rodney hatches a plan to get his own back on Eric, and Viv is thrilled to find she has won a luxury cruise

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Richard lets himself into Audrey's house while she is out so he can get cracking in his campaign to play tricks with her mind

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Audrey returns home to find the radio blaring out and Toyah's exhibit goes down a storm, but Les steals her thunder after a local reporter begs him for an interview

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A Midsomer Malham resident is accused of battering her best friend to death, but Barnaby cannot help feeling the evidence against her does not add up. The detective enlists the help of a pensioner, who also happens to be one of the key witnesses, to find out what really happened on the night of the murder - and realises the elderly lady's life could be at risk. With John Nettles, Jason Hughes and Thelma Barlow

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: In the aftermath of the Abbey's eventful party, Mary is forced to answer a pressing question about her future, while Carson reveals surprisingly intimate details about his former life. Rose's trip to the bright lights of London sees her risking the Crawleys' reputation, and Gregson shares ambitious plans with Edith, taking their relationship to another level. Costume drama, starring Maggie Smith, Hugh Bonneville and Elizabeth McGovern

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Two joyriders steal a car from outside the pub, unaware there is a radioactive isotope hidden in the boot _ and it is up to Mike to avert a potential catastrophe. Meanwhile, Greengrass gets a surprise visit from his brother, who begs him to look after a champion greyhound. Rural drama, starring Bill Maynard and Jason Durr

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The body of 19-year-old apprentice electrician Dennis Bayliss is discovered washed up on the shore of a North Northumberland rural estate. The victim turns out to be the estranged son of Steph and Rob Bayliss who are left crippled by his death, having lost him once already when he abandoned them to seek out his biological father, Thomas Walken, who just happens to run a salmon farm on the spot where the body was found. Vera is forced to look closer at the strained relationships of Dennis's two families in order to find the truth about his death

programme.title: Blue Murder
programme.desc: DCI Janine Lewis struggles to balance family life with an investigation into the murder of a cheerleading coach. Initial suspicion falls on the victim's husband, whose bloodied clothes are found near the crime scene, but the discovery of an affair suggests someone else may have had a motive. Guest starring Coronation Street's Chris Gascoyne

programme.title: Wycliffe
programme.desc: A psychiatrist's wife is murdered in a seemingly unprovoked attack, and establishing a motive proves harder than catching the killer. Meanwhile, Lane and Kersey disagree at every turn of the investigation. Jack Shepherd stars as the dour detective

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Sally is shocked by news of Megan's pregnancy and her mood is soured further by the discovery that Kim already knows about it. Work matters prove just as complicated when the nurses help a teenager in need of a kidney transplant whose health is further threatened by tensions between potential organ donors in her family. Guest starring Frances Barber and Stella Gonet alongside Samantha Giles, Holly Grainger and Denise Van Outen

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Sally bans Megan from seeing Luke and makes her feelings about her daughter's pregnancy very clear, which only serves to bring the teenagers closer together. A team-building exercise for the factory workers reaches a dramatic climax and the nurses help a woman suffering from alopecia come clean about her relationship with a younger man. Guest starring Jan Francis and Chris Bisson

programme.title: Goodbye Mr Chips (2002)
programme.desc: Martin Clunes stars as an earnest Latin master working at the Brookfield School of the 1880s, where he meets and marries his true love Kathie and finds himself touched by politics, grief and the utter devastation of World War One. Charting more than 50 years of one man's extraordinary life, the story ends in the 1930s, as a wise, elderly and much-loved Mr Chipping lives out his last days in retirement. Frank Delaney's adaptation of James Hilton's timeless classic, which has never been out of print since first appearing as a magazine serialisation in 1934, and for which Robert Donat whipped an Oscar from under the nose of Gone with the Wind's Clark Gable in the 1939 film production. Also starring Victoria Hamilton, Conleth Hill and Patrick Malahide

programme.title: Never the Twain
programme.desc: Simon has a fall and badly cuts himself, being rushed to hospital for emergency treatment. Having the same blood group a very reluctant Oliver agrees to donate blood for a transfusion and goes on to make the most of the situation. Comedy, starring Windsor Davies and Donald Sinden

programme.title: Carry On Girls (1973)
programme.desc: The council of a seaside town is in dire need of a means to attract tourists to its resort, so announces a beauty contest. While the conniving organiser plots a series of publicity stunts, an outraged feminist group plans to sabotage the event. Comedy, starring Sid James, June Whitfield, Joan Sims, Barbara Windsor, Bernard Bresslaw and Peter Butterworth

programme.title: Carry On Henry (1971)
programme.desc: King Henry VIII plots to rid himself of his new French wife when her craving for garlic becomes too much to cope with. However, he cannot afford to anger the king of France, and tries to make it look as if his queen has had an affair. Comedy, starring Sid James, Joan Sims, Kenneth Williams, Terry Scott, Charles Hawtrey, Barbara Windsor and Kenneth Connor

programme.title: Carry On Loving (1970)
programme.desc: A couple who run a dating agency find themselves inundated with customers, and end up arranging a selection of very unlikely matches - while also contending with their own marital difficulties. Comedy, starring Sid James, Hattie Jacques, Kenneth Williams, Charles Hawtrey, Bernard Bresslaw, Joan Sims and Terry Scott

programme.title: Carry On Follow That Camel (1967)
programme.desc: A disgraced English gentleman joins the Foreign Legion to restore his honour, and proves himself an unlikely hero. Meanwhile, his naive lost love learns he was innocent, and heads to the desert to bring him home. Comedy, starring Phil Silvers, Jim Dale, Kenneth Williams, Charles Hawtrey, Peter Butterworth, Bernard Bresslaw and Joan Sims

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: Change is in the air at the Abbey as an exciting opportunity for Alfred creates tension between Ivy and Daisy. Isobel appeals to Violet's sense of charity, but it doesn't come without a fight, while Branson considers a new future for himself and baby Sybbie. Raquel Cassidy (Teachers) joins the cast of the costume drama, with Matt Milne, Cara Theobold, Sophie McShera, Penelope Wilton, Maggie Smith and Allen Leech

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Neil and Maggie make a commitment, and a seemingly straightforward road accident soon leads to complications for the bobbies of Aidensfield. Meanwhile, Greengrass inherits an unusual legacy _ a pair of racing pigeons. Rural drama, starring Bill Maynard and Derek Fowlds

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: Despite the doctor's unpleasant attitude toward her, Louisa applies for a job at the school - where she quickly notices something strange about the new headmaster's behaviour. Martin refers Pauline's aunt and uncle to Edith after they have trouble conceiving a baby, but her tests lead one of the couple to make a surprising confession. Comedy drama, starring Martin Clunes and Caroline Catz, with David Haig

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: PC Penhale is delighted by the arrival of his older brother Sam, but their reunion turns to misery when Martin delivers bad news to one of them. Louisa searches for a new home in the village and visits Edith for a check-up, where she reveals an embarrassing piece of information, and Al makes his situation with Pauline worse by trying to act on advice from Bert. Starring Martin Clunes and Caroline Catz

programme.title: Blue Murder
programme.desc: Richard puts his life at risk by going undercover in a prison to find out information about the murder of a convicted child killer. Meanwhile, Janine finds herself embroiled in a personal crisis when her son Michael causes a car crash that leaves another driver seriously injured. Crime drama, starring Caroline Quentin, Ian Kelsey and Geoff Breton

programme.desc: Suspicion falls on a pagan sect steeped in ancient beliefs when a baby is found dead. Jack Shepherd stars, with Jimmy Yuill and Helen Masters

Forty-five-year-old Paul is constantly muscling in on the action with his 18-year-old bodybuilder son Kyle, and former glamour model Charmaine loves flaunting what she has, much to the embarrassment of 14-year-old Yasmin. programme.desc: Tim Marlow examines the work of Italian Renaissance painter Raffaello Santi, known better simply as Raphael, who was born in 1483 and achieved so much in his 37-year life that he was considered equal to Leonardo da Vinci and Michelangelo. programme.desc: A successful businessman who has turned his back on his old life in Wisconsin is reminded of his past by his jailbird cousin. Thriller, starring Michael Greyeyes, Chaske Spencer, Jesse Eisenberg and Kate Bosworth

programme.title: Song of the Sea (2014)
programme.desc: The last surviving member of a race of magical seal-children seeks the aid of her human brother for a special quest. The two of them set out on a journey to revive the seal's magical powers and prevent the spirit world from being lost forever. Animated fantasy, with the voices of Lucy O'Connell, David Rawle and Brendan Gleeson

programme.title: Patrick (2018)
programme.desc: A young woman's chaotic life becomes more complicated when she inherits her grandmother's dog. Comedy, starring Beattie Edmondson, Ed Skrein, Jennifer Saunders and Cherie Lunghi

programme.title: Spies in Disguise (2019)
programme.desc: A secret agent branded a traitor tries to clear his name, with the aid of a socially awkward inventor he had fired for only developing non-lethal gadgets. The scientist's latest invention gets out of control and transforms the spy into a pigeon - giving him the perfect disguise to prove his innocence. Animated adventure, with the voices of Will Smith, Tom Holland and Karen Gillan

programme.title: Monster Trucks (2016)
programme.desc: A drilling operation unleashes a subterranean creature which feeds on oil. The monster bonds with a monster truck which a local teenager is building from spare parts, and the youngster befriends the beast and helps it to return to its underground home. Fantasy adventure, starring Lucas Till and Jane Levy

programme.title: Skyscraper (2018)
programme.desc: A former hostage negotiator takes a job as a security expert at the world's tallest building in Hong Kong. He finds himself framed for sabotage when the skyscraper bursts into flames. As he strives to clear his name, he must also fight his way back into the blazing tower to rescue his family, who are being held hostage by criminals 225 storeys up. Action thriller, starring Dwayne Johnson, Neve Campbell and Chin Han

programme.title: Jack Reacher: Never Go Back (2016)
programme.desc: The nomadic vigilante tries to save an army major who has been framed for murder and treason. Jack Reacher discovers that Turner has been targeted by a secret government conspiracy, and together they go on the run to expose the truth. Director Edward Zwick's blockbusting action thriller sequel based on Lee Child's novel, starring Tom Cruise, Cobie Smulders, Danika Yarosh and Aldis Hodge

programme.title: Mulholland Drive (2001)
programme.desc: An actress arrives home to find a mysterious woman in her room who is suffering from amnesia. She sets out with the stranger to discover how she got there - but the trail quickly leads to intrigue, blackmail and murder. David Lynch's drama, starring Naomi Watts, Justin Theroux, Laura Harring and Robert Forster

programme.title: Paranormal Activity: The Ghost Dimension (2015)
programme.desc: A man moves into a new house along with his wife, daughter and younger brother, and finds an old camcorder and a box of videotapes. The siblings start watching the tapes, which turn out to be home movies shot by the property's previous owners, but by doing so, they unleash evil spirits into the world. Horror sequel, starring Chris J Murray and Brit Shaw

programme.title: Rango (2011)
programme.desc: A pet chameleon with an active imagination ends up lost in the desert. He makes his way to a lawless town of animals, where he is mistaken for a deadly gunslinger and made sheriff. He organises the townsfolk into a posse when bandits led by an evil rattlesnake steal their supply of water. Oscar-winning animated comedy, with the voices of Johnny Depp, Isla Fisher and Bill Nighy

programme.title: The 7th Voyage of Sinbad (1958)
programme.desc: The heroic sailor pits his wits against an evil magician who has shrunk a princess to the size of a doll - but to break the spell, he must journey to a mysterious island inhabited by hideous monsters and find a magic lamp. Fantasy adventure, starring Kerwin Mathews, Kathryn Grant and Torin Thatcher, with special effects by Ray Harryhausen

programme.title: Gulliver's Travels (2010)
programme.desc: A directionless loser tries to prove himself to the woman he loves by volunteering for a travel writing assignment. He is sent to the Bermuda Triangle, where he ends up stranded on an island populated by miniature people to whom he is a giant. Fantasy comedy, starring Jack Black, Emily Blunt, Jason Segel and Billy Connolly

programme.title: The Call of the Wild (2020)
programme.desc: A crossbreed dog stolen from his Californian home and taken north to the Yukon, where there is great demand for strong dogs to pull sleds in the frozen wilderness. As his new owner ventures deeper into the Arctic circle, the dog must rediscover his primal nature as a wild animal to survive. Historical adventure based on Jack London's novel, starring Harrison Ford and Omar Sy

programme.title: Now You See Me 2 (2016)
programme.desc: A gang of magicians-turned-criminals is reunited for a comeback performance by a ruthless technology magnate, whose actual goal is to force the team into carrying out a seemingly impossible heist on his behalf. The illusionists realise their only hope of avoiding the law is to perform one last unprecedented stunt to expose the businessman's illegal activities. Crime thriller sequel, starring Jesse Eisenberg, Mark Ruffalo, Daniel Radcliffe and Morgan Freeman

programme.title: Patriot Games (1992)
programme.desc: Former CIA agent Jack Ryan foils an assassination attempt by an IRA splinter group, killing one of the terrorists in the process. However, he becomes caught in a lethal game of cat-and-mouse with the dead man's revenge-seeking brother. Thriller based on Tom Clancy's novel, starring Harrison Ford, Sean Bean, Samuel L Jackson, Richard Harris and James Earl Jones, reprising his role from earlier Clancy adaptation The Hunt for Red October

programme.title: Dredd (2012)
programme.desc: An uncompromising law enforcer in a post-apocalyptic city is assigned to train a psychic new recruit. A report of three murders leads them to a tower block dominated by a ruthless drug lord, only for the gangster to seal off the building, forcing them to fight their way out. Sci-fi thriller based on the 2000AD comic-strip, starring Karl Urban, Lena Headey and Olivia Thirlby

programme.title: Last Action Hero (1993)
programme.desc: A boy watching an action movie is transported into the film by a magic ticket and meets its hero figure, who refuses to believe he is a fictional character. Matters take a turn for the worse when the screen villain gets hold of the ticket and crosses over into the real world - where bad guys can win. Comedy adventure, starring Arnold Schwarzenegger, Austin O'Brien, Charles Dance, F Murray Abraham and Anthony Quinn

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: James goes to extreme lengths to raise money for his sister Juliet's treatment, and love is in the air for Maxine, but she is not sure if it's reciprocated

programme.desc: Leonard is invited to visit the Large Hadron Collider in Switzerland and asks Penny to join him as a Valentine's Day treat. However, Sheldon tries to persuade the couple to allow him to take her place

programme.desc: Sheldon misses an opportunity to meet Spider-Man co-creator Stan Lee when he has to go to court for driving through a red light, and his anger leads to his imprisonment. Penny finds out the address of the comic-book writer and takes Sheldon there - but his troubles with the law have yet to reach their conclusion and the visit does not go as expected

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: The Osbourne family receive some fantastic news, but not everyone is in the mood for celebrating. A a thoughtful idea leads to a slap in the face for more than one person

programme.title: The Farmer Wants a Wife: Australia
programme.desc: The farmers are at the halfway mark in their search for a wife, and each takes a chosen lady on a romantic date. However, heartbreak pushes one farmer to face the music

programme.title: The Inbetweeners Movie (2011)
programme.desc: Awkward teenagers Simon, Will, Jay and Neil plan a holiday to the Greek island of Crete after they finish their exams, hoping to experience drink, sex and debauchery beyond their wildest dreams. However, things do not quite work out as planned. Comedy based on the TV series, with Joe Thomas, Simon Bird, James Buckley and Blake Harrison

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Anna Richardson presents the dating show in which two singletons choose a date from six naked people - and first up is 23-year-old Nameya from Bristol. Nameya is bisexual and hopes to find her perfect package in either a sexy guy or her first ever girlfriend. Next up is 35-year-old Dan from Bolton. Dan loves a fairy-tale but will her very own Prince Charming be standing behind one of the screens?

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Anna Richardson hosts the show in which six potential dates bare all bit by bit in a bid to prove they are the one. She is joined by 28-year-old nature lover Oliver from Norwich, who has never had a girlfriend, and 48-year-old building boss Claire from Manchester. They will both choose a date after seeing what their potential partners have to offer on a purely physical level. But will they prove to be a good match?

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The nation's favourite armchair critics share their opinions on what they have been watching in late October 2016, including Hunted, Poldark, Meet the Parents, Strictly Come Dancing, The Young Pope, The Great British Bake Off and the News. The programme captures their instant reactions and lively - sometimes emotional - discussions from the comfort of their own homes

programme.title: The Farmer Wants a Wife: Australia
programme.desc: The farmers are at the halfway mark in their search for a wife, and each takes a chosen lady on a romantic date. However, heartbreak pushes one farmer to face the music

programme.title: Below Deck
programme.desc: Rachel continues to struggle with the primary's requests, while Heather and Fraser have their hands full as they work without a third stew. Past actions throw Heather into a spiral, while Rayna battles with how to feel about her crew's transgressions

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Beverly involves herself in Erica and Barry's relationships, and Adam and Brea are cast opposite of each other in the school play, but rivalry sours things

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Erica goes on a date with a guy from the coffee shop, while Geoffrey ends up on an episode of The Dating Game. Beverly learns that Murray has spontaneously purchased a shore house

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Jay accidentally gatecrashes Mitch and Cameron's night out with their friends Pepper, Longines and Crispin, but surprisingly enjoys his time with the group. Meanwhile, Phil and Claire are concerned when Luke befriends neighbour Mr Kleezak, and despite Cameron's misgivings, Haley babysits Lily. Guest starring Nathan Lane (The Producers)

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty visits Mauritius to find out about white and dark rum and learns where the term 'proof' originally came from in relation to alcohol

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: The island of Crete holds a special place in the hearts of Roy and Caroline Loates as it's the place where they married. Now with a budget of 100,000, they want to make it their permanent home. Jasmine Harman selects five properties for them to choose between

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: A diving instructor in Marbella faces an uncertain future and, after being refused a mortgage back in London, a young couple head to Spain to start their own aerial yoga business

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien find, fix and flog unwanted possessions on behalf of their owners. Henry and Simon realise profit potential in an old crop sprayer, a cast iron fire guard and some old wooden workshop clamps

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Max McMurdo and Henry Cole visit a motorbike fan, making table lamps from engines and turning a pallet and iron wheels into a stylish modern coffee table

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The investigators uncover an interesting family history in the brewing trade while exploring the case of Evelyn Edwards. They also hunt for heirs to Garry Szymanski, who died in Birmingham in 2010, and try to find out if his father is still alive

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition commences at Churchill's Hotel in Barnsley, where the guests are treated to a day out at a nearby mill and the hotel's first ever breakfast service

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contest continues at Darnells' Farm Luxury Glamping in Ross-on-Wye, Herefordshire, where arachnophobe Snehal checks every corner of his lodging for unwanted eight-legged guests

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners stay the night at Hatton Court Hotel in Gloucester, a country style establishment that at first proves a hit - until cleanliness concerns, sleepless nights and missing breakfast items leave them disappointed

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The fourth and final visit is to the Ladbrooke Hotel in the heart of Birmingham, where manager Snehal Lakhani claims he accepts nothing less than perfection. A room with a broken window proves far from flawless for Natasha and Laura, while Danni and Graham are concerned about the proximity of a train line to their bedroom

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: On the final day of the competition, Churchill's Hotel's Jeff Brown and Vicky O'Loughlin are first to face the feedback and Jeff's keen to turn down the heating woes. Plus, Snehal from the Ladbrooke Hotel has a bone to pick with all of the B&Bers. After some frank discussions, the payments are revealed and the winner is announced

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Phil Spencer catches up with two couples whose property searches took some unexpected turns. In 2012, he was in Aberdeen helping Brian and Helen, who were relocating from Essex, with a house hunt featuring some cruel knocks along the way. How are the pair doing seven years on? In 2016, Mike and Sorrel needed Phil's help finding a home in the Tyne Valley. Having lost out on their dream home on the day they were meant to complete their purchase, they were looking to Phil to bring their two-year search to an end

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer help Rachael and Tim, who cannot decide to do with their home in Wandsworth, south London. New Jersey-born Rachael wants to up sticks and move to the countryside to bring up their children in more rural surroundings, and she is finding their four-bedroom semi something of a squeeze. However, local lad Tim would rather stay closer to his friends and family. Kirstie comes up with a plan to make better use of the space, while Phil aims to show the couple three properties that prove the grass is greener outside the M25

programme.title: Escape to the Chateau: DIY
programme.desc: Tim and Margreeth visit Dick and Angel, who come up with some radical suggestions to change their business plans. Stephanie hopes to prepare for her first singles weekend by planting a romantic rose garden - if she can work the digger. Near the Pyrenees, Sophie and James need to raise funds for their ancient chateau fast, so they decide to put on a day of historic talks, dinner and a tour. Later, Dick and Angel struggle to rescue the trampoline that's been blown into their moat

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud follows the progress of Nathan and Amye as they build a giant cathedral-like property modelled on Dutch barn-style houses, but with a contemporary twist. It is a hugely ambitious plan, and with Nathan project managing and setting themselves just a year to finish the build, the pressure to pull it off is huge

programme.title: 24 Hours in Police Custody
programme.desc: A man is arrested after punching a man outside a nightclub - a single blow that led to the victim's death. In the interviews, the police try to determine whether the punch was an unjustified and aggressive assault on an innocent man or an act of self-defence with tragic consequences

programme.title: In the Footsteps of Killers
programme.desc: Emilia Fox and criminologist Professor David Wilson investigate famous unsolved murder cases, continuing with the disappearance of Suzy Lamplugh. The estate agent vanished after making an appointment with a client in July 1986. Despite the high profile of the case, nobody has ever been charged with Lamplugh's abduction and murder. Following a series of tantalising clues, Emilia and David narrow the field of suspects down to just one man. Will he reveal the truth?

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: The air ambulance is dispatched to collect Frances, an 80-year-old woman who fell three metres into her empty swimming pool while gardening, and has sustained a head wound that could have resulted in a life-altering bleed on the brain. Ruth, aged 86, arrives at St George's A&E with her heart beating three times faster than the normal rate. Doctors are concerned it may not be pumping enough blood around her body, and quickly prescribe fast-acting medication. Plus, students Jerry and Sakille turn up at the hospital after Jerry crashed her car on the way home from a party. While Jerry stayed sober to serve as the designated driver, she concludes that balancing a full-time job with her studies and a hectic social life might not be a sensible idea

programme.title: 24 Hours in Police Custody
programme.desc: A man is arrested after punching a man outside a nightclub - a single blow that led to the victim's death. In the interviews, the police try to determine whether the punch was an unjustified and aggressive assault on an innocent man or an act of self-defence with tragic consequences

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown

Alex Horne and the Horne Section join Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner, while Rachel Riley takes care of the letters and numbers

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: The air ambulance is dispatched to collect Frances, an 80-year-old woman who fell three metres into her empty swimming pool while gardening, and has sustained a head wound that could have resulted in a life-altering bleed on the brain. Ruth, aged 86, arrives at St George's A&E with her heart beating three times faster than the normal rate. Doctors are concerned it may not be pumping enough blood around her body, and quickly prescribe fast-acting medication. Plus, students Jerry and Sakille turn up at the hospital after Jerry crashed her car on the way home from a party. While Jerry stayed sober to serve as the designated driver, she concludes that balancing a full-time job with her studies and a hectic social life might not be a sensible idea

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt investigates concerns about levels of naturally occurring arsenic in baby rice products, Jimmy Doherty examines Marks & Spencer's claim that they can trace all their beefburgers back to the cow, and Kate Quilton find out whether a parasite could be hiding in sushi. Programme exploring the secrets behind mass-produced food, meeting technicians, scientists, factory owners, growers and producers to find out exactly what goes into the groceries that end up on the supermarket shelves

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Kate Quilton visits the world's largest jelly bean producers to discover what they are made of instead of gelatine, and Matt Tebbutt finds out why maple syrup is so expensive

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: With their five children all grown up, Maria and Laky Zervudachi want to downsize and find two new properties to call home. They want a family home close to their favourite town of Lewes in Sussex, so that friends and a community are nearby, and a smaller apartment in sunny Palma in Mallorca so that Maria can practise yoga outdoors all year round. Jasmine Harman shows them three impressive family properties for their budget of 900,000 in and around Lewes and Jonnie Irwin lines up three possible apartments for 300,000 in Palma

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: The staff of a British-run dive centre discover a long-forgotten shipwreck in the Mediterranean. Two Englishmen explore the French wilderness on the lookout for a prehistoric cave, and wildfire threatens one couple's dream life in Spain

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien head east to Newark in search of their latest upcycling prospects. Simon finds an antique European threshing board, which he turns into a coffee table, and Henry's all at sea with a ship's porthole

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Simon O'Brien converts tank parts to garden furniture, while Henry Cole takes his life in his hands with a motorised skateboard. Later, Simon restores a model Hurricane, and Henry goes potty for a retro petrol pump

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The probate detectives look for the potential heirs of Birmingham pen-maker Gordon Clarke, who is said to have left a 40,000 estate, and also investigate the case of Jack Thornton, whose family name is revealed to have a surprising heritage

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&Bers are in Ramsgate, Kent for the first visit of the week, where partners Tess and Pete hope their seaside home from home, Rooms@119, will prove a relaxing retreat. Things don't get off to the best start though, when Hillary and Mark discover some unfinished business in their room. In the morning, Pete turns his hand to cooking for six for the first time ever, but finds out the hard way that any waiting around results in lost points come feedback time

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Mother and daughter Laurain and Kerry are second to host at Stable Oak Cottages in Maidstone, Kent, where they are confident their self-catering accommodation will be a hit

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Hosts and dairy farmers Hillary and Mark are hoping to show their guests some high-end hospitality at Hedgerow Luxury Glamping in Clitheroe, Lancashire. But Natasha and Tanya are put off by the discovery of a rather creepy visitor

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to The Antelope Inn, in Upavon, Wiltshire, run by Natasha, who's joined in the competition by friend and colleague Tanya. Some guests are underwhelmed by the decor, while Kerry and Laurain find themselves complaining over staining in their room. Over dinner, Natasha's revelation about how she became a landlady leaves some of the guests questioning her credentials

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Payment day has arrived, and the B&Bers have been sharpening their knives ready to clash over the comments they've left each other throughout the competition

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer catch up with two couples they met in 2016, Tom and Timna, and Kirsty and Rich, who were both looking for new homes in York. Tom and Timna were expecting their first child and needed more space for their family, while Kirsty and Rich decided to move to York from London to be closer to family. Did either couple find what they were looking for?

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: A mother and daughter need help from Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer as their three-bedroom Victorian cottage in Great Bookham, Surrey is too small and dark. Mum Abi cannot bear to leave the place she lived with her partner, who passed away a few years ago. But daughter Maddy believes her mum needs a fresh start

programme.title: Escape to the Chateau: DIY
programme.desc: Tim and Margreeth start to research their new business idea, but can they find the suppliers to help them? Stephanie's big event - her singles night - arrives, while Sophie and James put on a walking tour near their chateau

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets architect Iain and his wife Jenny, who intend to build an enormous black minimalist house right in the middle of a 19th-century Scottish country estate. Their grand vision also involves connecting the new rectangular block to a dilapidated gardener's bothy - and the neighbours are watching

programme.title: The Dog House Australia
programme.desc: Life at Animal Welfare League NSW, a picturesque dog sanctuary where people come in search of a canine soulmate. In the first episode, gentle giant Tessa the Bull Arab - a cruelty case rescue - hopes to find love with the Doyle family. Meanwhile, newly-weds Craig and Rodney consider whether they are the right fit for bonded pair Zoe and Buster

programme.title: 999: What's Your Emergency?
programme.desc: Cameras focus on the work carried out by Wiltshire's police, paramedic and fire services. Unarmed police officers are called to a Sunday league football match where a disgruntled player is brandishing an axe. In the early hours of Sunday morning, all available units are scrambled to assist an injured officer at a mass pub brawl

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: An 84-year-old is rushed into hospital after losing control of his car and crashing into a road sign, and is in need of an emergency transfusion after his blood pressure drops dangerously low. Elsewhere, seven-year-old Reggie needs surgery to fix his broken arm, and 66-year-old Christine comes into A&E with worrying symptoms after the entire left side of her body collapses

programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics
programme.desc: Medics fly to the aid of teenage mountain biker Steven, a multi-vehicle collision in Bedford leaves 32-year-old Ashley with potentially life-changing injuries, and Nicola steps in to save her husband Michael's life when he has a cardiac arrest

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty examines whether it is worth growing your own fruit and vegetables, or if the supermarket equivalent is always cheaper, and learns about Britain's current soil crisis. Helen Lawal exposes the lucrative trade of illegal trafficking of eels and Kate Quilton discovers what gives ginger beer its kick

programme.title: Kirstie's Vintage Gems
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp introduces new crafts, skills and techniques for interior decoration. In this edition, she reveals how to create a personalised doormat and coasters, using spray paint, old tiles and serviettes

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Now all their children have flown the nest, Vanessa and car fanatic Gary want to start the next phase of their lives by setting up a new home. The problem is Vanessa wants to settle in Lowestoft with family and friends nearby, while Gary wants to be in southern Spain where he can be close to Marbella's car scene. Help is at hand from Laura Hamilton, who delivers three homes in Lowestoft for their maximum 195,000 UK budget, while Jonnie Irwin tempts them with three amazing properties in the hills above Marbella with their 178,000 limit

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: A diving instructor looks for a change of career, a cottage accommodation business struggles to take off, and at the end of a tricky season an aerial yoga teacher ties the knot with her next door neighbour. However, as autumn approaches, have the Brits abroad managed to make their dreams a reality?

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien head to a private railway, where Simon converts a lantern to a stylish table and Henry turns a fire extinguisher into a steampunk lamp

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Max McMurdo restores a pair of designer chairs, while Henry Cole breathes new life into a decrepit garden table, transforming it into a colourful and valuable new one

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The probate detectives continue the two-year search for the beneficiaries of mariner Josiah Webbe's 70,000 estate, a hunt that has so far stretched from the Caribbean to Wales. They also try to track down the identities of a man's parents

programme.title: Four in a Bed

However, guests Lynn Self and Ziggy Broome have doubts over the cleanliness of their bedroom, and another couple are accustomed to more opulent surroundings

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Lynn Self and Ziggy Broome hope to impress with their two-star B&B Eden Lodge in Falmouth, Cornwall. However, the state of their property disappoints their fellow competitors. At dinner, James and Maria Church reveal the truth about their famous daughter Charlotte, and the following morning's breakfast reduces some of the guests to fits of giggles

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: It is the turn of Charlotte Church's parents James and Maria to play host at Dexby Townhouse in Cardiff, and they pull out all the stops by laying on a day of white-water rafting and a magic performance courtesy of their nephew Elliot. But the following morning, some of the guests are kept waiting for breakfast

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Newlyweds Pip Easby and Nicky Lesser-Easby, who run Muddifords Court Country House in Devon, open their doors for the final stay of the competition. The Churches find their four-poster bed too small, and not all the guests enjoy their trip to a local glass-blowing factory, but feedback at check-out time leaves the hosts feeling confident

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants meet one last time to discover how much they have been paid by their fellow hoteliers and to air their grievances. An underpayment from a surprising source changes the dynamics of the group and throws the competition wide open, before the winner is announced

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Catching up with two couples, Cherelle and Leon, and teachers Richard and Jo, who were both looking for new homes in 2017. In Croydon, Phil Spencer helped local couple Cherelle and Leon, who were rapidly being priced out the area. Meanwhile in Reading, teachers Richard and Jo sought Phil's aid as they searched for a new home for them and their two daughters, and had only six weeks to find one. Now, Phil returns to catch up with the couples and find out what happened next

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: Phil Spencer catches up with Alex and Danny Moore from Preston, who back in 2017 could not decide whether to stay in their quiet cul-de-sac or up sticks and move to the country. Kirstie Allsopp embarked on a loft conversion - claiming it's the best she has ever done - while Phil pulled some cracking rural properties out of the bag. But after making their decision, what was next for the couple?

programme.title: Escape to the Chateau: DIY
programme.desc: Dick Strawbridge joins Elaine and David as they look around an 1850s chateau with 25 rooms, telling them what to look out for when buying such a vast property. The programme also catches up with Tim and Krys from the first series, who renovated rooms for a boutique B&B in the Dordogne, but have been struggling to juggle parenthood with running the business

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets widowed teacher Gretta, who is making a fresh start in rural Cambridgeshire with a Malaysian-inspired burnt wood and glass home being designed by her nephew Carlos and project managed by her brother-in-law Fernando - despite his lack of building experience. However, as site clearance begins, so does the Covid-19 pandemic - and family harmony is tested when an apple tree much loved by Fernando is condemned for removal by Gretta

programme.title: Astrid: Murder in Paris
programme.desc: A Japanese gallery owner is found dead, with his little finger sliced off. In considering why he might do this to himself, evidence begins to point to a connection with the Yakuza. Drama, starring Sara Mortensen and Lola Dewaere. In French

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A 61-year-old woman is airlifted to hospital after a car mounted the pavement and ran her over and doctors quickly get her into the CT scanner to ascertain the full extent of her injuries. Elsewhere, 91-year-old Sam arrives after suffering a suspected stroke, and four-month-old boy Teddy is rushed in after falling face first out of his car seat, hitting the pavement
